loans.name: Lernik

texts.en:
Lernik thanks for his first Kiva loan by the help of which he perfectly organized his son's nice wedding party. Lernik lives in Kadjaran city of Syunik region. He graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute, the faculty of Biochemistry.

After graduation he started to work at the school as a teacher of chemistry and kept on from 1988 until today when he works as a director of the school and he is also a teacher of biology. At his house he also gives paid private courses in biology and prepares the pupils for the entrance exams.

Lernik is divorced and now he lives alone. His two sons are already married and they live in Yerevan city with their families. This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Lernik requests as he wants to buy a computer and also professional literature for his private courses with the pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature for his private courses with the pupils.

loans.name: Jai Vadjai Mata Mbg-E Group

texts.en:
Monali Yogesh, 27, standing to the left, is a woman who works in hair aesthetics, manicure, pedicure, and make up. Her characteristics are: being a person who is organized, honest, strong, and friendly, andwho does everything possible to offer good customer service, since her primary objective is to get them to come back.

Monali Yogesh is the single mother of two children, ages 7 and 5. She lives with her children and she dreams of having her own house and paying for her children's education and, on the way, improving their living conditions.

Monali Yogesh has gained ground in the manicure and pedicure sector, but she is also very well-trained for styling hair, dying, highlighting, giving haircuts, etc., so she along with her group member wants to ask for a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase chemicals, dyes, combs, clips, and other tools to improve her hair care services.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, dyes, combs, clips, and other tools to improve her hair care services.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman with three children. She operates a tailoring business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. Damaris will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials.

Damaris hopes that in the future, the business will grow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman who describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking gas. She has been involved in this business for eight years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of gas. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more gas cylinders and for refilling costs.

She hopes that in the future, the business will grow. Margaret's business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders and refilling costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Annman

texts.en:
Annman is 57 years old and lives alone in the Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Her husband is working abroad in the Russian Federation and her son is in the army doing his military service.

Annman has vocational education, but also learnt all the skills of tailoring since a young age. She is a very renown and respected master not only in her village. For several years she used to work at a textile factory as a tailor, but now she takes her orders at her house.

She perfectly sews curtains, bed linen, and also dresses for women and children. Annman does her work very well, which is why she always has a lot of orders and also a number of regular customers. She also manages to take care of her cute farm where she has cows, a bull and pigs.

She needs this loan as she has great order and a lack of fabric, so she will buy enough fabric with this money and manage to fulfill her order on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman who describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells milk, soda, rice, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items.

She hopes that in the future, the business will grow. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 40-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married with two children ages 11 and 15 years old. Her Husband is a carpenter while Elsa is running a vegetable farm. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years.

She is asking a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to continue her business. In the future, she wants to have a better means of living. With this, she works hard to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in a rural village of Battambang province, Sophat is a 35-year-old mother of five dependent children; four of them are in school while the other one is too young to attend school.

In order to support her family’s living, she has grown rice, corn and cassava as the main sources of income for six years. Meanwhile, her husband is working for others for a fee to supplement her family’s income.

Due to lacking of working capital to support her farming, she is now leading a group of three to apply for a new loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she paid back her past loan successfully. With the previous loan, she could support her family’s living well.

As the leader, she is going manage her entire loan portion to buy bags made of reeds used for carrying the corn and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that she could prepare her corn yield to sell on time to and able to earn more income to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy reed bags to carry corn and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with one child. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her business is located in an area with growth potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.This will enable her to increase sales and profits. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the business. She hopes that in the future, the business will grow.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jai Vadjai Mata Mbg-D Group

texts.en:
Ahire, 47, is the lady standing to the extreme left in the photo and is the featured borrower of Jai Vadjai Mata MBG-D from a small village of Maharashtra,India. She is a tailor by profession and earns her livelihood through this. She is a mother of two grown up son and the wife of a mason. Ahire belongs to a very poor family and has been deprived of civic resources.

She is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR along with her other group members. Ahire will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and attach necessary sanitary fittings to it.

Ahire aspires to grow in her business and increase her customer outreach so as to increase her cash flow.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and attach necessary sanitary fittings to it.

loans.name: Jlg-001-Karupathur Group

texts.en:
Periyakkal has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. All three group members work hard to support their families and save diligently.

However, their finances are not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their homes. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives and opportunity offered by GUARDIAN and Milaap, they now seek a loan of 42000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these three hardworking, rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to construct toilets and improve sanitation facilities in their homes.

loans.name: Jai Vadjai Mata Mbg-F Group

texts.en:
Punam Yogesh, 21, standing to the extreme right, is a humble lady from Maharashtra, India. She is a tailor by profession and is a blessed mother of a one-year old-daughter. Punam Yogesh lives with her husband who is an auto rickshaw driver by profession. The income of both of them is still not enough to build a toilet for her home.

Therefore, she along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. Punam yogesh will use her portion of the loan amount to build a new toilet and install a hand pump to facilitate the water supply. This will help her promote hygiene and cleanliness in the community.

Punam Yogesh has a dream to provide her daughter the best education and a bright future.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and install a hand pump

loans.name: Jay Bhadra Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Suvarna Nitin, 24, standing to the extreme right, is the featured borrower of Jay Bhadra SHG-A. She hails from a small village of Maharashtra,India. A vegetable and fruit vending business is the source of income for her. She has a small family consisting of her husband and two sons who are in elementary school. Suvarna works very hard in order to fulfill all the necessities for her family. Unfortunately, she is lacking a toilet and has to go outside to attend nature's call.

Therefore, Suvarna Nitin, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR to build a new toilet and increase her hygiene. Access to toilet at her home will reduce the chance of getting contaminated with harmful diseases.

Suvarna Nitin dreams of building her own house and having a happy life with her family.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Sandhya Rani

texts.en:
39 year old Sandhya lives in a small village in Khagrabari in West Bengal. She is a courageous mother of one son. Her husband runs a business of sound systems and Sandhya is a seamstress. Both of their incomes are so small that they can hardly afford all educational expenses of their son after bearing the household costs.

Sandhya's son Sagar is a student of Bachelor of Arts (B.A) – First year in Cooch Behar College. He has always been an average student. But with his hard work and determination, he tries to excel. Sagar is confident that he can score good marks in his upcoming examination if he gets the help of good tutors. But Sandhya is unable to provide sufficient study materials and private tutors to her son.

The only way out is financial help and thus Sandhya is seeking an educational loan from BJS(a Kiva field partner) to engage good tutors and purchase study materials for her son, which will ensure that Sagar will achieve a good marks in his examination with his hard labor and dedication.

Sandhya and Sagar(as in the photo) are obliged to their lenders.

loans.use: To pay all over education costs of her only son.

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
Sabina continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tipo snack. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque sus ventas mejoraron y no tuvo problemas (de pie al centro, viste chompa rosa y cartera negra). En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los emprendedores, son; venta de jugos batidos, venta de celulares,  venta de refrescos, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en yeso, confección de tejidos, venta de medicina natural y elaboración de sombreros de sao. Su negocio creció debido a las mejoras que pudo realizar, los clientes son continuos y diarios, “amplié mi negocio comprando muebles, las ventas crecieron y los insumos de cocina se terminan a diario…” comenta.  La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; harina, arroz, fideo, carne, aceite, etc. Su sueño es continuar mejorando su negocio por el bien de su hijo, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para abastecer su negocio y que este continúe funcionando. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sabina solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para abastecer su negocio y que este continúe funcionando.
texts.en:
Sabina continues with her business selling snack foods.  She invested her previous loan in the purchase of tables and chairs for her business.  Her loan payments were on time because her sales improved and she didn’t have any problems.  For this loan opportunity, she is leading the entrepreneurial bank.  The entrepreneurs’ businesses are: selling blended juices, selling cell phones, selling soft drinks, selling cosmetics, selling food, selling second-hand clothing, plaster crafts, textiles, selling natural medicines, and making straw hats.  

Her business grew due to the improvements she managed to make.  Her customers come frequently and daily.  She says, “I expanded my business, buying furniture.  Sales increased and the ingredients run out every day.”  The advantage of her business is that her sales are daily and ongoing.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital for buying supplies and ingredients such as flour, rice, beans, oil, etc.  

Her dream is to keep improving her business for the good of her son.  She wants to purchase ingredients in bulk in order to stock her business and keep going.  This is her second loan cycle with this institution in fifteen years of running this business.  It is for these reasons that Sabina is asking for a loan: to buy ingredients in bulk in order to stock her business and keep going.

She is pictured standing in the center, dressed in a pink sweater with a black handbag.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies in bulk in order to stock her business and keep going

loans.name: Love

texts.en:
Love has a sari-sari (convenience) store attached to her house in Getafe, Bohol. This has been her business for three years now. She sells soft drinks, coffee, sugar, chocolate drink, liquors and beer.

She is asking a loan of 5000 PHP to buy canned food, seasoning, condiments, toiletries and powdered fruit juice for retail sale. Love works hard for her three children ages five, ten and eleven.

Her income will allow her to continue sending her children to school, provide food for her family and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy canned food, seasoning, condiments, toiletries and powdered fruit juice for resale.

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive academic record, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Divine chose Kepler because it offered her the best opportunity to pursue her dream of becoming a business leader.

Divine plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She thinks her greatest contribution to Kepler will be her ability and willingness to work with classmates to understand difficult points. After graduating, she hopes to use her skills to give back to her family and her community.

Divine's goals at Kepler are to improve her public speaking skills and general academic knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Talitha

texts.en: Talitha is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a cyber café where she offers internet browsing and photocopying services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are youthful. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use the Kes. 50,000 loan to buy printing paper and other stationery. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her standard of living. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open more cyber cafés

loans.use: to buy printing paper and other stationery.

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said is a married man. He has one child. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area. He will use the Kes. 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Senmela Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Rini is married and lives with her family in the Kamrup district of Assam. She runs a stationery shop in the locality. Even though she earns an impressive 6,000 Rs. from her business, she falls short of stock in her shop. She realized that she had to match the supply to the increased demand. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to expand her business so she can increase the stock in her shop to include notebooks, pencils, pens, etc.

Rini formed a group with Riju, Priyonka, Sangita, Bijita, Jaanmani and Mira who face the same situation as she does. Each of these women runs a business of their own. They lack the funds to expand their respective businesses. Together, they seek a loan of 105,000 Rs ($1,625 USD). Your loan will help these women expand their businesses. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her stationery shop.

loans.name: Maghanga

texts.en:
Maghanga is a single man who describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a computer services business where he offers computer training and printing. He has been involved in this business for eight years.

His business is located in an area with growth potential and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy laptop. His business goal is to have a computer school within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to start a computer school.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Above All Group

texts.en:
Above all Group was formed in the year 2000 at Chorkro in greater-Accra region, Ghana. There are four active women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the group members are from good families. All the members of the group have their own professions and businesses.

Doris is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members' sources of revenue improvement. She is about 35 years old and living with her husband and children.

Doris has been engaged in selling wax-print (textiles) and general goods at the market and sometimes hawking for seven years. The monthly income of Doris from this business is good.

In Doris’s opinion, this income is not at all sufficient to maintain her family and hence, she is requesting for loan to make more profit and increase income. She planned to improve her business with more investments but the availability of funds is the main concern. From this loan, she will purchase more wax-print which she will sell to her customers so that she can make more profit. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to take care of her home and for reinvesting.

The other three members of her group are also smart in their professions and actively engaged in different businesses like foodstuff, smoked fish, fresh fish and a hair dressing service.

loans.use: to purchase more wax-print for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with three children. She operates a food stall where she cooks mandazi, chapati and other food stuffs. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are school children and locals.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy cooking pans and food ingredients. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy cooking pans and food ingredients.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, eggs and cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes. 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables, eggs and cereals. Her business goal is to open a cereals store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, eggs and cereals.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en: Momo is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are individuals. She will use the Kes. 95,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to open a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a comfortable life. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and bags. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes. 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to preserve meat and other foods for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman with two children. To earn a living, she is running a banana farm. Aside from the banana farm she also has a rice farming business.

Virginia has been running this kind of business for 30 years. To help her increase her livelihood she is asking a loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. In the future, she aims to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a 64-year-old woman with eight adult children. For many years, she has been helping in the fishing business of her husband, raising hogs and selling puto (a steamed cake made from cassava).

She is asking an additional capital of PHP25000 to buy sugar, cooking oil, floaters, nylon and fishing weights. She hopes that if she can gain access to CEVI’s financial services, she will be able to support and expand her businesses, thus augmenting her income.

In the future, she hope to have a comfortable and prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, floaters, nylon and fishing weights.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, cooking oil ,sugar and other items.

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables.

Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, cooking oil, milk, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, cooking oil, milk, flour, soap and other items.

She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, cooking oil, milk, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and other food stuffs. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticiapated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a single man. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail business where he sells tomatoes, bananas,cabbages and other vegetables. He has been involved in this business for two years.

His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will have a bigger business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cabbages, tomatoes, bananas and other vegetables.

loans.name: Sristi Group

texts.en:
Neelam lives with her family of four in the Kamrup district of Assam. She is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is the group leader.

She realised the need to increase her savings to secure her children’s future. She runs a tailoring business in the village. The existing income level is not enough to manage the household expenses. Thus, she wants to expand her business and earn a higher income.

The other members of the group are also engaged in various income generation activities like garment selling, cloth selling and a tailoring business, etc. All the members will use the loan to buy more stock and raw materials to expand their respective businesses. Therefore, they all joined hands to form the group and applied for a loan for upgrading their business.

Your loan will help them contribute more to the household income. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of raw materials for her tailoring business and sell blouses, sarees, pants and skirts.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 29 years old. He lives in the Khelvachauri district with his wife, son and mother.

Gela is involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, he owns a plot of agricultural land where he grows fruit to sell.

Gela decided to purchase a greenhouse and requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of GEL 4,200. With the received credit Gela will purchase a greenhouse and seeds of vegetables. He will grow vegetables there to sell 2-3 times during the year and generate a good profit.

Gela is very hardworking man and hopes that the business will be profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a greenhouse and grow vegetables there to sell

loans.name: Nicolás De Tolentino

texts.es: Nicolás en medio de las dificultades que vivió en su pueblo natal a raíz del conflicto armado, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla en la búsqueda de un nuevo comienzo y una vida digna, apoyado por sus familiares y vecinos emprendió su negocio de venta de picadas y fritos, los cuales comerciaba de puerta en puerta de cada una de las casas del sector, así logró la cobertura deseada y con ello ingresos para el sustento de su numerosa familia;  su cónyuge y cuatro hijas. Su línea de productos no se limita únicamente a productos para el consumo, también comercializa prendas de vestir y calzado, sin embargo como su capital le es insuficiente para la demanda que posee y la competencia cada vez mayor, ofertando a precios de oportunidad, Nicolás está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en prendas de vestir, calzado, colonias e insumos para la producción de picadas. Con esta inversión podrá comprar un nuevo surtido de mercancía en diferentes proveedores con precios más ajustables a sus necesidades.  Su meta a futuro es continuar creciendo en su negocio y apoyar a sus hijas en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nicolás, who lived amidst the difficulties caused in his hometown by the armed conflict, came to the city of Barranquilla in search of a new start and a decent life.

Supported by his relatives and neighbors, he started his business selling picadas [a dish made with chopped meat, chicken, yucca, and other vegetables] and fried snacks, which he sold door to door at every one of the houses in the sector. In this way, he achieved the desired sales coverage, and with it, the income for supporting his large family: his spouse and four daughters. His range of products is not limited solely to food; he also sells clothing and footwear. However, his capital is not enough for the demand that he has, and the competition is constantly increasing, offering bargain prices.

Nicolás is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to invest in clothing, footwear, cologne, and supplies for the production of picadas. With this investment, he will be able to purchase a new supply of merchandise from different suppliers with prices that are more adjustable to his needs. His goal for the future is to continue growing in his business and supporting his daughters in their studies.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, footwear, cologne, and supplies for the production of picadas.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a widowed woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, cabbages and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages and other vegetables. This will enable her to have more stock, hence more sales and profits.

She hopes that in the future she will live a better life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages and other vegetables.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up with six sisters in a remote village in Rwanda, and because of his commitment and impressive academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. He chose Kepler because it offers a strong business curriculum.

Joseph plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At Kepler, Joseph hopes to continue running community-based projects as well as developing the skills he'll need to succeed in his career. After graduating, he wants to either start his own business or work at a startup.

In his free time, Joseph enjoys music and playing basketball.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Senhor José tem 58 anos de idade, casado, pai de 10 filhos dos quais seis estão ainda na sua responsabilidade frequentando o ensino primário e secundário, é avicultor e aposentado, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de pintos, rações, vacinas, para a criação de frangos.
No futuro pretende construir uma casa de raiz, visto que agora vive em uma casa em condições precárias sem conforto nenhum.
O seu maior desfio é  garantir o sustento escolar dos filhos para um futuro melhor e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old, married, and father of 10 children, 6 of whom are in primary or secondary school and still in his care. . He is retired and raises poultry.  He owns the home where he lives with his family. 

The loan amount requested will be used to purchase chicks, feed, and vaccines to raise chickens.  In the future, he plans to build a new house, since the one he lives in is in poor condition with no comforts. His biggest challenge is paying for his children's education so that they have a better future, and paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, and vaccines to raise chickens.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt:
Senhora Paulina tem 28 anos de idade, casada e mãe de uma filha sem idade escolar, é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de repolho, cebola, alface, em farmas para revender no mercado grossista da cidade.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e construir casas para arrendar como forma de aumentar a renda da família.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora como forma de garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 28 years old.  She is married and has one daughter who is not yet school aged.  She is a merchant and owns the home where she lives with her family. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase cabbage, onions, and lettuce from farms for resale in the wholesale market in the city.  In the future she plans to finish construction on her house and construct rental houses as a way to increase the family's income.  Her greatest challenge is to pay off the loan on time in order to have access to future loans.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage, onion,and lettuce in farms to resale at the wholesale market in the city.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rain season which affects business. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Sarmento

texts.pt:
Senhor Sarmento tem 37 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frequentando o ensino primário, e um sem idade escolar, é carpinteiro, vive em casa própria casa com a sua família a qual sustenta.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de madeira para o fabrico de mobiliário para a venda.
No futuro pretende transformar sua carpintaria numa grande indústria de produção de mobiliário fornecendo a um mercado mais amplo.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a solicitar mais e consequentemente acelerar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Sarmento is 37 years old.  He is married and father of 3 children, 2 of whom are in primary school and one who is not yet in school.  He is a carpenter and owns the home where he lives with his family, whom he supports.

The loan will be used to purchase wood to make furniture for sale.  In the future he hopes to transform his carpentry business into a large-scale furniture producer so he can supply a larger market.  His greatest challenge is to pay off his loan on time in order to request additional loans to accelerate his projects.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make furniture for sale.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
A Senhora Gilda vive na casa propria com seu esposo, seu filho mais novo e uma sobrinha. É comerciante, com o presente empréstimo vai fazer compra e venda dos seguintes produtos válvulas de cunha, tubos, sanitas e torneiras de jardim. Tem como sonho ampliar a sua residência e mobiliá-la.  
Suas dificuldades são financeiras pelo que tem se esforçado com o trabalho para poder suprí-las e realizar seus sonhos.
texts.en: Gilda lives in her own home with her husband, her youngest son, and a niece.  She is a merchant.  With this  loan she is going to purchase and sell the following products:  gate valves, pipes, toilets, and garden faucets.  Her dream is to add on to her house and furnish it.  She has financial difficulties, so she works hard to overcome them and realize her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase gate valves, pipes, toilets and  garden faucets.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
Elvira es una mujer de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 16 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de velas.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, trabajadora, constante y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘plan 3000’ dónde hicieron su hogar los damnificados del desborde del río, situado a 12 kilómetros del centro de la ciudad. Los pobladores llegaron de las provincias y el resto del país y se asentaron en esta zona que hoy tiene más del 20% del total de la población, Es el distrito más pobre. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Elvira es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la segunda de la izquierda, viste de celeste). Su vida la realiza con sus 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de chapa y madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su familia, en esta oportunidad lidera la banca de personas, los negocios de los integrantes son; tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, llantería y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de velas artesanales, ella se especializa en la creación de velas ecológicas con cera de abeja, las ceras más comunes que utiliza son; Cera de Abejas virgen (cera completamente natural, directamente sacada del panal), cera de Abejas virgen en láminas, cera de Abejas Amarilla en perlas (filtrada de mayor calidad), Cera natural Blanca de Abejas (cera refinada a la que se le ha eliminado el color y el aroma a miel), “la cera de abeja es la mejor por su perfume agradable y el color amarillo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con un público definido como ecologista, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de cera de abejas por mayor. Su sueño es producir por mayor para abrir una tienda y dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de cera de abeja por mayor para fabricar velas en gran cantidad y abrir una tienda. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elvira solicita un préstamo para la compra de cera de abeja por mayor para fabricar velas en gran cantidad y abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 43-year-old woman who is single with 2 children, ages 13 and 16. Her business is candle-making.

She is a good mother, independent, hard-working, persevering and very responsible. She does her work at a market in the Plan 3000 zone where homeless flood victims made their homes, 12 kilometers from the city center. The inhabitants arrived from the countryside and around the country and settled in this area, which today contains more than 20% of the total population. It is the poorest district. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate with daytime temperatures that vary between 21-35 degrees Centigrade.

Elvira is dark-skinned with gray-brown eyes, has long black hair that she wears tied back, and is short and stocky. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish in society and in her business transactions. (She is the second from the left, dressed in sky blue.) She lives with her 2 children, who both study in school. They live in their own house, which is made of sheet metal and wood, with a corrugated roof and dirt floor and has running water, electricity and sewer service.

Because she needs to cover her family's expenses, on this occasion she is leading the group in their application for a loan to improve their businesses. The members' businesses are: neighborhood store, butcher shop, sandwich shop, plaster crafts, drink stand, tire shop and sale of secondhand clothing. Her business is the making and sale of handcrafted candles. She specializes in eco-friendly candle-making from beeswax. The most common waxes used by her are: virgin beeswax (completely natural wax, harvested directly from the hive), sheets of virgin beeswax, yellow beeswax in pearls (filtered for higher quality), natural white beeswax (refined wax which has had the color and the honey scent removed). “Beeswax is the best because of its pleasant aroma and yellow color," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she has a clientele defined as "green"; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy the beeswax wholesale. Her dream is to produce wholesale and open a store and stop selling in the street. She hopes to buy beeswax wholesale to make a large quantity of candles and open a store. This is her fourth round of loans with this institution since she started this business 10 years ago.

That is why Elvira is requesting a loan to buy beeswax wholesale to make a large quantity of candles and open a store.

loans.use: buy beeswax wholesale to make a large quantity of candles and open a store.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Tereza continúa con su negocio de panadería tradicional. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de un horno industrial. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio tuvo éxito (sentada a la derecha, viste chompa negra). Su negocio se encuentra en pleno crecimiento y sus ventas aumentaron, en esta oportunidad formó la banca de personas con negocios como;  confección de tejidos, venta de comida, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de frutas y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es el horneado de pan tradicional, para esta actividad se necesita diferentes tipos de harinas para diferentes tipos de panes, “mi panadería está creciendo, los clientes son más y ahora quiero vender por mayor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas duran toda la semana, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de harina por quintal. Su sueño es ampliar su panadería para vender por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes tipos de harina por quintal. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Tereza solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por quintal para vender pan por mayor a las tiendas de barrio.
texts.en:
Tereza continues with her traditional bakery.  The loan she obtained was invested in the purchase of an industrial oven.  She made her payments on time because her business had success.  In the photo she can be seen to the right, in the black sweater.  Her business grew and her sales increased.  On this occasion she makes up part of the group of people with businesses such as: sewing, food sales, plaster crafts, a book store, fruit sales, and a butcher's shop.  They are requesting a loan to improve their businesses.

Tereza's business is baking traditional bread.  For this work she needs different types of flour for different breads.  She comments: "my bakery is growing, I have more customers, and now I want to sell by wholesale".  The advantage of her business is that the sales last all week, the disadvantage is the lack of money to purchase flour by the quintal.

Her dream is to expand her bakery to sell by wholesale, she wants to purchase different types of flour by the quintal.  This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the five years she been doing this activity independently.  It is for these reasons that Tereza is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy flour by the quintal to sell bread wholesale to the stores in town.

loans.name: Las Patitas Group

texts.es:
“Las Patitas” está conformado por personas muy alegres pero sobretodo muy trabajadoras ellas viven en una comunidad mazahua, que se caracteriza por ser muy tranquila llena de arboles gran parte de la población se dedica a la cría y engorda de animales o al cultivo de maíz que el alimento principal durante todo el año.
Las integrantes del grupo platican que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque así le dicen a la representante del grupo Paty, entre ellos existe un lazo de amistad que les permite desarrollar varias actividades juntas.
Patricia o Paty como le dicen de cariño es muy amable pero sobretodo muy alegre siempre esta de muy buen humor ella tiene 29 años de edad, está casada con Héctor juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando.
Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos por catalogo, ella platica que la idea surgió junto con su esposo porque desafortunadamente el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba y de alguna manera  ellos deberían solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.
“Afortunadamente me va muy bien tengo buenas clientas  que seguido me compran” comento Paty muy contenta, aprovecha cada reunión familiar, en la escuela, con sus amistades y vecinas para ofrecerles dice que su única dificultad es cuando sus clientas se tardan en pagarles pero en general le va muy bien.
Ella viaja a su municipio para hacer su pedido y recogerlo igual debe acudir al municipio donde hay una sucursal de la marca de los zapatos para que le puedan hacer entrega del pedido, para que inmediatamente se las entregué a sus clientes, los pagos se los hacen en dos exhibiciones. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en más zapatos para continuar con su actividad.
La meta de Paty es hacer crecer su negocio para que con sus ganancias ella pueda establecer una zapatería o un restaurante, cree que si llegara a tener un negocio estable su calidad de vida mejoraría.
Los integrantes del grupo son Domitila quien invierte en antojitos mexicanos, Maria Dolores en su carnicería y cremería, Puebla en verduras, Jesus en platicos, Martha en una veterinaria, Aylin en ropa, Martha S. en papelería y Laura en borregos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleritas del Kiosco del municipio, Paty es quien tiene el chaleco negro*
texts.en:
“Las Patitas” is made up of people who are very happy and above all, are very hardworking. They live in a mazahua community, which is characterized for being very calm, full of trees, and a large part of the population works raising and fattening animals or growing corn which is the main source of food year round.

The members chat about the name of their group, which they chose for the nickname they call the representative of the group, Paty. Amongst them there is a bond of friendship that allows them to realize various activities together.

Patricia or, Paty, as they call her lovingly, is very friendly but above all, is very happy and is always in a very good mood. She is 29 years old, is married to Hector, and together they have formed a family with two children who are currently studying.

For nine years, she has worked buying and selling shoes through catalogues. She shares that the idea to do this came with help from her husband because unfortunately, her husband’s income was not enough and, in some way, they needed to cover their household expenses and the education of their children.

“Fortunately, my business is going very well and I have good clients who continue to buy from me,” said Paty, very happily. She makes use of every family reunion, at the school, with her friends and neighbors to offer them her products. She says that her only difficulty is when her clients are late in paying her but that, in general, it is going well for her.

She travels to the municipality to place her orders and pick them up. Even still, she must go to the municipality where there is a local branch of the shoe brand so that they can give her the orders, so that she can immediately deliver them to her clients. She makes the payments in two installments. With the new loan she will invest in more shoes to continue with her business.

Paty’s goal is to grow her business so that, with her income, she can open a shoe store or restaurant. She believes that if she achieves having a stable business, her quality of life will improve.

The members of the group are Domitila, who will invest in Mexican snacks, Maria Dolores in her butcher shop and dairy product sales, Puebla in vegetables, Jesus in plastics, Martha in a veterinarians, Aylin in clothing, Martha S. in paper products, and Laura in sheep.

*The picture was taken at the steps of the municipal kiosk. Paty is the woman wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Roca Y Coronado Group

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dinámica, constante, activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por una intensa actividad económica que generó el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Claudia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la derecha, viste polera blanco y cartera gris). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de chapa y madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la obligaron a liderar la banca de personas con actividades como; venta de comida, venta de productos médicos naturales, confección de tejidos, reparación de electrodomésticos, venta de verduras, panadería y librería, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de empanadas tradicionales. Las empanadas son una masa en forma de media luna rellena de jigote que se fríe en abundante aceite o se cuece al horno. Existen de diferentes tipos, como: El cuñapé (a base de harina de arroz y queso), el sonso (yuca molida con queso al horno), el pan de arroz, la empanada de maíz y otras, “todos los horneados son tradicionales y forma parte de nuestra cultura diaria, acompañados con un café o té, son irresistibles para cualquiera…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y de costumbre, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de diferentes tipos de harina por quintal. Su sueño es contar con un negocio estable para que sus hijos sigan sus pasos, ella desea realizar la compra de harinas de arroz, maíz, trigo, centeno, y otros insumos de cocina. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por quintal para establecer su negocio y traspasarlo a sus hijos en el futuro.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 29 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has two children aged 6 and 11 years old. Her business is selling empanadas.

She is a good mother, enterprising, dynamic, consistent, active, responsible and very hard working. She has her business in the Southern zone of the city which is an area of intense economic activity which generated the establishment of large markets with innumerable stores and shops. It has a hot sub-tropical climate with a daily temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Claudia is dark skinned, with brown eyes, long black hair that she ties back, short in stature and robust in build. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (In the photo she is the first to the right wearing a white shirt and has a grey purse). She lives her life with her partner who works as a builder and her two children who study at school. They live in their own house made of sheet metal and wood with a metal roof and brick floor and has running water, electricity and sewage.

Her desire to excel made her lead a communal bank of people with businesses such as; selling meals, selling natural medicinal products, weaving, appliance repairs, selling vegetables, a bakery and a bookstore to request a loan to improve their businesses.

Her business is making and selling traditional empanadas. Empanadas are a dough shaped like a half moon filled with minced filling that is fried in abundant oil or baked in the oven. There are different kinds such as: El cuñapé (with rice flour and cheese), el sonso (minced yucca with cheese baked in the oven), el pan de arroz, the corn empanada and others. "All of the baked ones are traditional and form part of our daily culture. We have them with coffee or tea and they are irresistible" she comments.

The advantage of her business is that sales are daily and routine. Her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy the different types of flour by the quintal. Her dream is to have a stable business for her children to follow in her footsteps. She wants to purchase rice, corn, wheat and rye flour and other cooking supplies. This is her second loan with the institution in the two years she has been doing this business.

For these reasons Claudia is requesting a loan to buy flour by the quintal to establish her business to pass on to her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour by the quintal to establish her business to pass on to her children in the future.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.pt:
Mãe solteira de 4 filhas, todas maiores de idade e cada uma em seu lar, vive sozinha  dependedo de negocio de venda de roupa usada. Foi com este negócio que conseguiu criar e educar suas filhas, esta a repetir o credito pela  4ªvez, com os anteriores conseguiu investir não só no negocio, mas também na remodelação de alguns bens em sua casa, conseguiu lançar a primeira pedra da construção de uma casa de material convencional, pois a anos que vive numa de material precário. 
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada: lençóis, toalhas de mesa e de banho e na medida do possível, investir também na continuidade da sua obra.
Ela gostaria de continuar a desenvolver o seu negocio e concluir a construção de sua casa.
Seu desafio, é o facto de as vezes o seu negocio não sair segundo seus planos, devido a quebras na escolha dos fardos e o facto de estar sempre a mudar de local de venda a procura de onde melhor possA sair o seu produto.
texts.en:
Delfina is a single mother with 4 daughters, all of whom are adults, each with her own home. She lives alone and depends on her used clothing business.  This business allowed her to raise and educate her daughters.  This will be her 4th loan, and with the prior loans she was able not only to invest in her business but also to remodel some parts of her home.  She was able to place the first stones on a home built of conventional materials, because for many years she has lived in one built of substandard materials. 

With this loan she plans to purchase bundles of used clothes: sheets, table and bath towels, and to the degree possible, to invest in continuing her construction project. She would like to continue to develop her business and finish construction on her house.  Her challenge is that sometimes her business doesn't perform as planned, due to a failure when selecting the bundles, and because she is always changing location to try and find the best place to sell her product.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothes: sheets, table and bath towels, and to the  degree possible, to continue investing in her construction project.

loans.name: Dinis

texts.pt:
Tem 61 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 13 filhos dos quais, 8 maiores de idade e cada um com seu lar e cuida apenas de 5, todos com acesso a educação. É agricultor já a longos anos e é sua principal fonte de renda, sempre usou os créditos para investir na agricultura, esta a repetir pela 4ªvez.
Pretende comprar semente de batata reno e pestecidas.
Seu maior desejo é continuar a investir na agricultura em grande escala, uma vez que quando consegue produzir com sucesso, poderá investir em outras planos pessoais convista a melhorar suas condições de vida e garantir um bem estar para sua família.
Seu maior desafio reside no risco que corre na sua actividade, porque pode muito bem investir e vir a perder tudo devido a factores climáticos e/ou por oscilação do mercado, mas mesmo assim nunca desistiu  de tentar.
texts.en:
Dinis is 61 years old. He lives with his common law wife and is father to 13 children, 8 of whom are adults who have their own homes.  He still supports 5 children, all of whom attend school.  He has worked in agriculture for many years and this is his primary source of income.  He has always used his loans to invest in agriculture and this will be his fourth loan.  He plans to purchase potato seeds and pesticides. 

His greatest dream is to continue investing in large-scale agriculture, and once he is a successful producer, he will be able to invest in other personal plans in order to improve his living conditions and provide will being to his family. 

His greatest challenge is the risk he faces in his field, because he can invest very well and lose everything due to climactic factors or changes in the market, but despite that he has never stopped trying.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
Tem 29 anos de idade, mãe de 4 filhos menores, 2 dos quais com idade escolar e com acesso a mesma, é segunda esposa  de um marido agricultor, vive na casa própria, dedica-se a venda de  produtos  alimentares diversos e bebidas em sua casa ou por encomenda. Esta a tomar o crédito pela primeira vez com a Hluvuku e pretende com este aumentar o seu stock.
Pretende comprar:  farinha, oleo, ovos, fraldas, omo, refrescos,etc.
Seu maior sonho é poder desenvolver mais o seu negocio  e melhorar suas condições de vida.
Diz não ter muito a se queixar, apesar de algumas vezes o negocio não sair tal como o seu plano.
texts.en:
Laurinda is 29 years old.  She is mother to 4 young children, 2 of whom are of school age and attend school.  She is the second wife to her husband who works in agriculture.  She owns the home where she lives and sells various food and drinks products from her house or by order.  

She is requesting a loan for the first time with Hluvuku and plans to use this to restock. She plans to purchase flour, cooking oil, eggs, diapers, Omo brand products, soft drinks, etc. Her greatest dream is to be able to further develop her business and improve her living conditions.  She says she doesn't have much to complain about, except that sometimes the business doesn't go according to her  plans.

loans.use: to purchase flower, cooking oil, eggs, diapers, Omo brand products, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 49 años de edad, vive con su pareja, no tiene hijos, y su negocio es la confección de cortinas. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, se encuentra al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Miriam es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en el mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación por la necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevó a solicitar un crédito. Su negocio es la confección de cortinas, en el inmenso mercado textil existente se pueden conseguir cortinas de toda variedad; rompedoras, modernas y para todo tipo de espacios, “no sólo el estampado marca la personalidad de la cortina, también la forma en que éstas se confeccionan…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una cartera de clientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para cumplir con sus pedidos de cortinas. Su sueño es ampliar su taller de costura, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Miriam solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para cumplir con sus pedidos y ampliar su taller de costura.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 49-year-old woman. She lives with her partner, has no children, and her business is making curtains.

She is enterprising, independent, persevering, active, responsible and very hard working. Her business is located in the "Plan 3000" area, which is characterized by its multicultural population, including Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes. The area is in the South of the city. Migrants dominate the area, and they contributed to constantly growing commerce. The area has a hot, tropical climate, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius during the day.

Miriam has dark skin, dark eyes, long brown hair, a short stature, and a strong physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in her area, and she speaks Spanish in everyday life and in business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in the same business. They live in their own room, built of brick and cement, with a metal roof and cement floor. Their home has electricity, drinking water, and indoor plumbing.

Her dreams of improvement and the need to improve their business have brought her to request a loan. Her business is making curtains. In the massive textile market that exists, it is possible to get all types of curtains: delicate ones, modern ones, and ones for all types of spaces. She says that not only the print shows the personality of the curtain, but the way in which it was made also does.

The advantage of her business is that she has many clients; the disadvantage is the lack of capital available to buy an industrial sewing machine to complete her orders for curtains.

Her dream is to grow her sewing workshop. She wants to buy an industrial sewing machine to complete the orders she has. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the 10 years that she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Miriam requests a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to complete her orders and grow her sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to complete her orders and grow her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 47 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija 5 años, y su negocio es la confección de gorros de lana.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, independiente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la feria ‘16 de julio’ dónde se lleva a cabo la feria comercial más grande del país, los días jueves y domingo desde tempranas horas de la mañana, feria en la que se puede encontrar cualquier tipo de cosas que se necesite. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su hija que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de gorros de lana para niños, ella inició su actividad como ayudante de una amiga, después compró una máquina de tejer y se independizó, “para un gorro de lana se necesita un ovillo de 100 gramos de lana, la lana que utilizo es bastante gruesa y, además se la puede utilizar para modernas bufandas...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que el frio del lugar hace que sus ventas sean constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina de tejer doble. Su sueño es producir nuevos diseños para vender por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de tejer doble para crear nuevos diseños y venderlos por mayor a comerciantes minoristas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer doble para crear nuevos diseños y venderlos por mayor a comerciantes minoristas.
texts.en:
Maria is a 47-year-old woman, who is single and has a 5-year-old daughter. Her business is the production of wool hats. She is a good mother, is enterprising, consistent, independent, an optimist, responsible and very hardworking. She does her business in the 16 de Julio trade fair, the largest trade fair in the country, held on Thursdays and Sundays from very early in the morning. You can find anything you need at the fair. The climate is cold and dry, with daytime temperatures that vary between 0-12 degrees Centigrade.

Maria is dark-skinned with gray-brown eyes and long black hair, which she wears down. She is short and stocky. Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish in society and for business transactions. She enjoys life with her daughter who is still not of school age. They live in a home owned by her family that is constructed of brick and cement, with a corrugated roof and wood floor. The home has running water, electricity, gas service and sewer system.

Her business is the production of wool hats for children. She started in the business as the apprentice to a friend; then she bought a knitting machine and went independent. “For a wool hat, you need 100 grams of wool. The wool I use is quite thick, and can also be used for modern scarves, " she says. The advantage of her business is that it is a cold place and this keeps her sales consistent; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a double-bed knitting machine. Her dream is to produce new designs to sell wholesale.

She hopes to buy a double-bed knitting machine to create new designs and sell them wholesale to retail vendors. This is her first round of loans with the institution since she started to work independently in the business 2 years ago.

That is why Maria is requesting a loan to buy a double-bed knitting machine to create new designs and sell them wholesale to retail vendors.

loans.use: to buy a double-bed knitting machine to make new designs and sell them wholesale to retail vendors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy modern banana tissues and suckers to improve quality banana production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy modern banana tissues and suckers to improve the quality of banana production.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 51 años, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 31 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, sacrificada, generosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad; que se  caracteriza por acoger a la población migrante del campo-ciudad, que genera una intensa actividad económica conformada por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro grisáceo largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que son independientes y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; hamburguesas, salchipapas (papas fritas con salchichas), sándwich de huevo y pollo frito. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma ambulante, “mi carrito se hamburguesas se encuentra dañado, necesito reponerlo para continuar trabajando…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas y clientes diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un carrito hamburguesero nuevo para continuar trabajando. Su sueño es tener un carro sandwichero, Ella desea realizar la compra de un carrito hamburguesero para reponer el que tiene y continuar trabajando. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito hamburguesero nuevo para reponer el anterior y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 51-year-old woman. She is single, has 2 children who are 25 and 31 years old, and her business is selling fast food.

She is a good mother, enterprising, sacrificing, generous, patient, responsible, and very hard working. Her business is located in the South of the city, which is characterized for embracing migrant populations from the country. This area generates a lot of economic activity from the minor and informal businesses. The area has a hot, sub-tropical climate, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius during the day.

Carmen has brown skin, dark eyes, long grayish-black hair that she wears tied back, a short stature, and a strong physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for everyday life and for her business. She shares her life with her children, who are independent and working. They live in their own house, built of wood with a metal roof and a dirt floor. The house has drinking water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

Her business is selling fast food, including hamburgers, sausages (fried potatoes with sausages, egg sandwiches, and fried chicken. She does this work everyday of the work as a street hawker. She says that her hamburger cart is damaged and that she needs to replace it to continue working.

The advantage of her business is that she has regular sales and clients. The disadvantage is the lack of capital for buying a new hamburger cart to continue working. Her dream is to have a sandwich cart. She wants to buy a hamburger cart to replace the one she has and then continue working. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the 20 years she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Carmen requests a loan to buy a new hamburger cart to replace her old one and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a new hamburger cart to replace the damaged one and continue working.

loans.name: Percina

texts.pt:
Jovem de 24 anos de idade, muito cedo perdeu o 1º marido, mãe de 3 filhos todos menores de idade 2 deles órfãos de pai, vive em casa dos pais, mas já tem sua casa própria, vive a base de negocio através do qual sustenta seus filhos, esta a repetir o credito pela segunda vez e com o primeiro investiu no aumento do stock na sua barraca construída no quintal de seus pais onde ela pretende continuar a investir.
Pretende comprar: óleo, açúcar, frangos, feijão, farinha, ovos, arroz, bolachas, sumos, batata, cebola, etc 
Ela tem planos de continuar a fazer crescer seu negocio de maneiras a sustentar seus filhos e construir uma casa de material convencional.
É mãe viúva e solteira de 3 filhos que teve muito cedo e deve cuida-los sozinha e tem dado sua total dedicação nisso para que nunca falte algo a seus filhos, esse é o seu maior desafio
texts.en:
Percina is a young woman aged 24.  She lost her first husband very young.  She is the mother to 3 young children, 2 of whom were orphaned by their father.  She lives in her parents' home, but she also has her own house.  She supports herself and her children with her business.  

This will be her second loan.  With her first loan she restocked her stand which is built on her parents' property.  She plans to invest in this again.  She will purchase cooking oil, sugar, chickens, beans, flour, eggs, rice, cakes, juices, potato, onion, etc.  She plans to continue growing her business in order to support her children and to continue building a house from conventional materials.  

She is a widowed single mother of 3 children who had to learn very early to take care of them alone, and she has given total dedication to this so that her children never lack anything.  This is her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to purchase  cooking oil, sugar, chickens, beans, flour, eggs, rice, cakes,  juice, potatoes, onion, etc.

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.pt: O Baltazar é casado, vive com a esposa e três filhos. É policia, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, nomeadamente cimento,chapas de zinco, barrotes. Tem sonho de voltar a estudar, construir e dar continuidade com os estudos dos filhos.Tem como maior desafio trabalhar cada vez mais e ter mais financiamentos na Hluvuku.
texts.en: Baltazar is married and lives with his wife and 3 children.  He is a policeman. With the current loan  he plans to purchase construction materials, namely cement, zinc panels, and beams.  His dream is to go back to school, construction, and continue to support his children's education.  His biggest challenge is to always work harder and to get more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc panels and beams.

loans.name: Jay Bhadra Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Chaitali Pravin is 32 years old and a single mother of her only son. She is the one standing to the left in the photo. Not long ago, she managed to start her own business, a shop in which she sews for third parties. She learned this skill through classes she attended. Her business allowed her to overcome a tough economic situation she experienced after being unemployed for several months.

She is currently faced with a problem. She lacks the machines that would allow her to work more productively. For that reason, she, along with her group member, seeks a loan of 30,000 INR to buy an overlock sewing machine and a semi-industrial sewing machine.

Chaitali Pravin wants to continue working until she achieves her dreams of buying a home, and having good economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and a semi-industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Abhijeet Group

texts.en:
Labanya is the group leader of Abhijeet Group. She lives with her family of three in Assam, in the North-Eastern part of India. She runs a jewelry shop and the other members of the group run their own businesses. Labanaya wants to expand her business as she feels that her income is not enough to meet family expenses. She wants financial assistance to expand her business. She requests 175,000 INR ( 35,000 INR per member) to buy semi precious stones, imitation gold, and other materials to expand her shop. Your loan will help them contribute more to the household income.

They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase costume  jewelry to expand her jewelry shop.

loans.name: Willis

texts.en:
Willis is a married man and describes himself as enterprising. He has operated a transportation business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and servers local customers.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the 20,000 KES to service and maintain his vehicle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and  maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
A senhora celeste  de 46 anos de idade, é  mae viuva de 5 filhos dos quais 2 ja maiores de idade e a trabalhar e 3 a estudar e sustenta 4 netos que vivem com ela na casa propria.
Diz que com este credito ira comprar feijao, pedacos de frango, peixe para reforçar o seu negocio na sua casa .
