Crescer no negocio, respondendo as necessidades de seus clientes e continuar a sustentar os estudos de seus filhos ainda menores e seu maior sonho.
Principais desafios insuficiencia de fundos e conta com ajuda dos seus dois filhos para sustentar a familia e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para atingir seus objectivos.
texts.en:
Celeste is 46 years old. She is a widowed mother of 5 children, of whom 2 are adults who are working and 3 are in school. She also supports 4 grandchildren who live with her in the home she owns. 

With this loan she is going to purchase beans, chicken pieces, and fish to restock the business she has in her home. Her greatest dreams are to grow her business, meeting her customers' needs, and to continue to support her younger children with their education. Her main challenge is a lack of funds.  She has help from her 2 children to support the family and she will request more loans to achieve her goals. 

.

loans.use: to purchase beans, chicken pieces, and fish.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 1 child who describes herself as optimistic. She has operated a retail business to sell clothes for 7 years. Her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use 20,000 KES to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to l have a stable business and family life within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year old Pratima lives in a small village in Khagrabari, West Bengal. She is a proud mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband is a day laborer who works for daily wages. His income is inconsistent, so Pratima runs a small grocery shop to support her family financially. Together, the couple’s income is inadequate to bear the educational cost of their two children after managing the household expenses. Her son and daughter both read in grade 11.

Pratima's son Dipankar is a student of grade 11 in Khagrabari Harendra Chandra Vidyamandir. He is a commendable student and scores good marks in all his examinations. With his hard work and determination, he tries to give his best, prevailing over the obstacles that come his way.

But now he needs the help of good tutors and some study materials for his continuous study. As Pratima is unable to provide sufficient study resources and private tutors to her son, as a responsible mother, Pratima is seeking an educational loan from BJS (a Kiva field partner).

This loan will help her to engage good tutors and purchase study materials for her son, which will ensure that Dipankar will achieve good marks in his examination with his hard labor and devotion.

Pratima and Dipankar (in the photo) are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to bear the education costs of her elder son.

loans.name: Kalyani-01 Group

texts.en:
Karabi, the group leader of Kalyani - 01 group, has a small doll-making business. She lives with her family of four in Assam, in the North - Eastern part of India. Karabi needs to increase her savings to secure her children’s future, as the family's existing income level is not enough to manage the household expenses. Thus, she wants to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Karabi is seeking a loan to purchase raw materials such as cotton, beads, cloth, etc. Similarly, the remaining members of the group are also engaged in various income-generating activities and need working capital for the expansion of their respective businesses. They are applying for a sum of Rs. 130,000.

The increased income from their expanded businesses will help them boost their income and save more in the long run for their children's education and for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: To expand her doll-making business by purchasing raw materials like cotton, beads, cloth etc.

loans.name: Umarani

texts.en:
Umarani is 49 years old and lives in the village of Jogendrapur at Falakata with her four family members. She is a proud mother of two children (a son and a daughter). As she has completed her secondary board examination, she was determined to provide good education to her children, and she is successful in her mission. Her daughter is now receiving education of graduation level, and her son is in his first year of his M.A. education.

Umarani's son, 17-year-old Subhankar, is a bright young boy. Now he is pursuing a Master of Arts degree in History from North Bengal University, with an aim to be a good teacher. Being a housewife, Umarani runs her bag business jointly with her husband. This is the only source of income for the family. Through their tireless efforts, the amount they earn hardly covers their family’s expenses. But, Umarani is keen to provide her son with a good education so that he can lead a life far better than theirs. For this, she approached Kiva’s partner BJS to fund her son's education.

She wants to utilize the loan amount to purchase her son's necessary study materials, and pay course fees and private tuition fees. She also hopes that the loan will enable Subhankar to go ahead with his education smoothly so that he can establish himself to get a good job in the future.

Umarani and Subhankar (in the photo) are thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: to bear the expenses for her son's master's degree education.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a Kiva borrower. He has five children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a motorcycle transportation business. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a fleet of matatus (minibuses) within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motor vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jay Bhadra Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Chavan, 42, is the lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She is a very charismatic and humble lady who enjoys a simple living with her small family, consisting of her husband and a daughter who is pursuing her studies in a college.

Her husband is a farmer by profession and struggles really hard to meet the needs of his family. Chavan does not have a toilet facility in her house.

Chavan, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet with well-equipped sanitary fittings. This will enable her to maintain health and cleanliness in her family.

loans.use: to build a toilet with well-equipped sanitary fittings.

loans.name: Majia

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Majia lives in a small village in Khagrabari, West Bengal. She is a careful mother of a son and has a great determination to provide her only son a good education. Being a housewife, she works hard to provide every support to her son. She runs her animal husbandry for the financial sustenance of her family.

Majia’s son, 17-year-old Abdul, is studying in grade 12 in Sarada Govt. High School. He is serious about his studies; he is studying hard to score good marks in his Higher Secondary Board examination. But, Majia faces difficulties to bear the education expenses of her son after meeting the household costs with the inadequate income of the family, yet she is striving hard to provide uninterrupted education to her son.

Hence, as a responsible mother, Majia is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the educational expenses of her son. She plans to pay educational fees, buy study materials, and engage a good private tutor for her son, so that he can easily continue his studies without any obstacles.

Majia and Abdul (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear her son's educational expenses for grade 12.

loans.name: Kijoolu

texts.en: Kijoolu is 47 years old. She is married with four children. She has had a maize farming business for six years. She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and manure, and she hopes this will help her pay school fees. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds and manure to help her pay school fees.

loans.name: Radha Group

texts.en:
Priya is the leader of a group of enterprising women. Married, she owns a small business of selling ready-made garments. The income from it has been enough to cover the household expenses of her family of 4 living in Kamrup, Assam. 

However, with no savings in hand for future needs, she feels insecure and unsafe. So, to earn enough to be able to save some earnings, she wants to expand her business. The other members of group also need money for similar enterprising purposes. 

This is why they have applied for a loan of Rs. 90,000. The loan amount will be used to purchase bulk stock of varieties of ladies' garments. Adding in fashion tops, blouses, leggings, saree and kurtis will push her sales. Also the lump sum amount will allow her to buy these pieces in bulk. The borrowers, who are hopeful of a better future, are posting the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of varieties of ladies' garments for her ready-made garments business.

loans.name: Cruz San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Don Francisco un hombre de campo pero muy trabajador, tienen 46 años de edad esta casada con la señora Hilaria desde hace 27 años juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales ya ninguno es dependiente de dicha pareja. 
Platica que desde hace 27 años se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de borregos platica que su negocio lo inicio porque mientras el trabaja en la construcción de casas su esposa se quedaba en casa al cuidado de sus hijos pero Doña Hilaria siempre quiso ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.
 Platica que cuando inicio su negocio lo inicio solo con dos borreguitos pequeños que le costaron entre 500 pesos a 600 pesos, de ahí poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio de sus buenas ganancias las ha aprovechado para comprar mas borreguitos, los compra desde pequeños por síes o siete meses, Don Francisco junto con su esposa deben trabajar muy duro para lograr que sus animalitos alcancen su peso y tamaño ideal para obtener mejores ganancias. platica que cuando los adquiere lo hace en su misma comunidad y cuando esta apunto de vender lo hace con sus propios vecinos o busca las personas que hacen barbacoa. "Pero generalmente aprovechamos cuando hay alguna celebración en su comunidad sea boda, primera comunión, bautizos, etc. es cuando mas nos comparan" comento Don Francisco.
 Esta vez su préstamo le ayudará a comprara tres borreguitos pastura por el momento no comprara porque aprovechara lo que tiene del campo para no gastar, Don Francisco esta muy agradecido con todos los prestamos otorgados de VFMexico porque realmente han sido de gran ayuda porque actualmente tiene dos casas en donde una en donde vive y la otra se la regalara a sus hijos.
 Los integrantes del grupo son Demetrio,  quien invierte en refacciones de bicicletas, Pablo en un sonido musical y Gloria en borregos.
 *La fotografia fue tomada en las escaleritas del kiosco del municipio, Don Francisco es quien tiene la chamarra azul*
texts.en:
Don Francisco is a hardworking farmer. He is 46 years old and has been married to Hilaria for 27 years. They have three children and none of them is dependent.

He has been breeding and raising lambs for 27 years. He started this business because while working in the construction, his wife who stayed at home, always wanted to help with the household expenses and the education of their children.

He started his business alone with two lambs that costed 500 pesos to 600 pesos. The business has slowly grown and that enabled him to buy more lambs. He buys them at six or seven months old. Don Francisco and his wife must work hard to get their animals to reach their ideal weight and size for good profits. They get them in their own community and when they’re about to sell, they do so with their own neighbors or find people who barbecue. "But generally we take advantage of celebrations in their community such as wedding, first communion, baptism, etc." commented Don Francisco.

Loan will help to buy three pasture lambs to take advantage of the unused field. Don Francisco is very grateful for all the loans of VFMexico because they have been really helpful in obtaining two houses, one for themselves and the other for their children.

Group members are Demetrio, who invests in bicycle parts, Pablo in musical sound and Gloria in lambs.

* The photograph was taken on the stairs of the municipal kiosk. Don Francisco is in blue jacket *

loans.use: to buy lambs.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbages, pineapples and onions. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

Her business is located in a well-established market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and to construct a business premises. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables and to construct a business premises.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susana is 29 years old. She is married and has one child. She operates a welding business, making metal doors, window frames and wheelbarrows. She has been in the business for 5 years. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy metal for making doors, window frames and wheelbarrows and hopes this will enable her to make more income. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her child and buy food for the family. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy metal for making doors, window frames and wheelbarrows. She hopes this will enable her to make more income.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. 

She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beans and maize. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.She will use the anticipated profits to buy land

loans.use: buy more stock of beans and maize.

loans.name: Bleidis Julieth

texts.es: Bleidys de 21 años, identificó una oportunidad de negocio al palpar que los habitantes del sector en donde reside al sur de Barranquilla, debían trasladarse muy lejos de sus hogares para realizar llamadas a los diferentes operadores de celular, fue así como decidió invertir sus ahorros en planes y teléfonos celulares, para ofrecer desde su vivienda minutos y golosinas.  Bleidys es una ama de casa con un gran sentido para los negocios y muestra de ello es que también comercializa productos por catálogos y útiles escolares.  Gracias a la gran afluencia de clientes que llegan a su negocio sus ventas son cada vez mayor, por eso está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de una fotocopiadora, una vitrina, surtido de papelería y productos de uso personal.  Con esta inversión tendrá un nuevo ingreso e iniciará a cumplir su meta de ampliación del negocio con nuevos productos y servicios. Ella es madre de una bebe de siete meses a quien le ofrece bienestar fruto de su trabajo y es su principal motivación para continuar muy entusiasta y comprometida.
texts.en:
Bleidys, age 21, identified a business opportunity upon noticing that the residents of the sector in which she resides in the south of Barranquilla had to travel very far from their homes in order to make calls with the different cellular operators. It was thus that she decided to invest her savings in calling plans and cellular phones in order to sell minutes from out of her home, and also, snacks.

Bleidys is a housewife with a great business sense, which is demonstrated by the fact that she also sells catalog products and school supplies, and thanks to the great influx of customers to her business, her sales are constantly increasing. That is why she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in the purchase of a photocopier, a display case, paper supplies, and personal use products. With this investment, she will have a new income, and she will begin to achieve her goal of expanding the business with new products and services.

She is the mother of a seven-month-old baby whose well being is the reward for her work, and who is her principal motivation for staying very enthusiastic and committed.

loans.use: to invest in a photocopier, a display case, paper supplies, and personal use products.

loans.name: Wendwaoga 02 Moince Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOROU est responsable du groupe WENDWAOGA 02 MOINCE. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 05 personnes en charge.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 02 sacs d’engrais et 01 boite d’insecticide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle
texts.en: Mr. MOROU is the head of the WENDWAOGA 02 MOINCE group. He is a married father of three, the eldest of whom is 10 and the youngest of whom is 1. Two of his children attend school, and he is responsible for five people. Mr. MOROU has been gardening since he was 10. He stocks up in the nearby markets. With the granted loan, he plans to buy two bags of fertilizer and one box of insecticide. He wants to use his earnings to strengthen his business. He has the ambition to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy two bags of fertilizer and one box of insecticide.

loans.name: Cameline

texts.en:
Cameline is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, flour, sugar and other items. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, soap, flour, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIATOU est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école  et elle a 07 personne en charge.
Mme fait de la transformation du jus de fruit depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 03 sacs de sucre, 02 sacs de lait en poudre, et 10 boîtes conservateurs.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et une moto.
texts.en: Mrs. SAFIATOU is a married mother of three, the eldest of whom is 15 and the youngest of whom is 4. Two of the children attend school, and she is responsible for seven people. Mrs. SAFIATOU has been making fruit juices for more than 15 years. She stocks up at the nearby markets. With the granted loan, she plans to buy three bags of sugar, two bags of powdered milk, and ten cans of preservatives. She wants to use her earnings to grow her business. She has the ambition to buy a plot of land and a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy three bags of sugar, two bags of powdered milk, and ten cans of preservatives.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, who is 31 years old, is married and supports three children. She is a hardworking small scale farmer, earning about KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers, seeds and herbicides to spray her crops to improve the yields. 

She plans to use the profits gained to educate her children, as well as to expand her farming activity. She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy certified fertilizers, seeds and herbicides to spray her crops to improve the yields.

loans.name: Kalyani-01 Group

texts.en:
Nirmali, the group leader of Kalyani-01 Group has been running a clothing business for 6 years. She lives with her family of four in Assam, in the north-eastern part of India. 

She feels that their current income is not enough for her family expenses and thus wants to expand her business. She wants to increase her stock but is facing a shortage of capital. She is seeking a loan for purchasing sarees, nighties, blouses, salwar pieces, etc. 

The other 4 members of the group are also engaged in various income-generating activities but are facing a shortage of capital. So, they decided to take a loan of Rs.130,000. They are well aware of the group rules and agreed to abide by them. They are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand her clothing business and sell sarees, blouses, salwars pieces, etc.

loans.name: Rangpur-01 Group

texts.en:
Manjula, the group leader of Rangpur-01 group, runs a clothing business. She lives with her family of three in Assam, in the northeastern part of India. She is seeking a loan to expand her clothing business, as she feels that her current income does not meet her family's expenses. 

She will use the loan to purchase sarees, nighties, blouses, etc. The other members of the group are also involved in various income generating activities and want to expand their businesses.

As the proceeds from their current level of business is not enough to meet family expenses, they decided to form the group and applied for a loan of Rs. 100,000. They are well aware of group rules and agreed to abide by them and are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand her cloth business and sell sarees, blouses, salwars pieces, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy pequeña vive Doña Ana Maria, se caracteriza por tener muy pocos habitantes pero son personas muy amables, trabajadoras, gran parte de la población cuenta con un pequeño negocio ademas de que se dedican a la cría y engorda de animales, al cultivo de animales.
 Ana María  es muy trabajadora ante todo responsable tiene 51 años de edad esta casada con el señor Manuel con quien ha formado una familia con cuatro hijos ninguno depende de dicha pareja, ahora son abuelos de su primer nieto, Doña Mary como le dicen de cariño se dedica a la venta de tacos desde hace 18 años, ella cuenta que inicio porque un familiar de su esposo tenía un restaurante-bar pero tiempo después dejo su negocio fue así como el esposo de Doña Mary retomo el negocio  la venta de los tacos. Ahora con su préstamo esta pensando en comprar una camioneta porque la que tenían se la robaron y la utilizaban para moverse para su negocio parte de que no tiene una camioneta para moverse también a Doña Mari es la falta de dinero para comprar en cantidades grandes el alimento para sus cerditos porque comenta “Si el alimento estuviera mas barato yo tendría los mismos cerditos que con anterioridad tenia” Doña Mari llego a tener 70 cerditos solo para engorda pero el precio el alimento se ha elevado mucho y cree no poder mantenerlos a todos.  Los cerditos que compro los crecerá y engordara solo en cuatro meses después de este tiempo piensa venderlos en sus puestos de comida corrida como tacos de carnitas, La señora Mari tiene tres puestos de tacos en el municipio, aunque ahora esta algo preocupada porque 12 de sus cerdos medianos están enfermos no han querido comer esto realmente le preocupa porque si llegan a morir sus ganancias e inversión se perderían.
 El sueño de Doña Mary es seguir conservando su negocio y seguir dando trabajo a otras personas actualmente tiene tres trabajando con ella.
 *La fotografia fue tomada en su casa alado de un carrito de tacos*
texts.en:
Ana Maria lives in a small community known for having very few inhabitants, but they are very kind and hard working. A large part of the population has small businesses, in addition to raising and fattening farm animals.
 
Ana Maria is very hard-working and, above all, responsible. She is 51 years old and married to Manuel, with whom she has formed a family including four children, none of whom are now dependent on the couple. Now the couple are grandparents with their first grandchild. “Dona Mary,” as she is affectionately known, has sold tacos for some 18 years. She says that she began because a family member of her husband's had a restaurant-bar which he eventually abandoned. Thus Mary's husband came to take charge of the business and they sold tacos.    

With this loan, Ana Maria intends to purchase a small truck because the one they had was stolen. It would be utilized for the business since they have none at present. Also, Ana Maria lacks the money to purchase feed in large quantities for her pigs. She comments, “If feed were cheaper, I could produce the amount of fattened pigs that I used to.” Ana Maria used to have 70 pigs just for fattening but the price of feed has risen so much that she doesn't think she can maintain that many. The pigs she recently bought will be raised and fattened in just four months. After this, she expects to use them in her lunch stalls for preparing pork tacos. 

Ana Maria has three taco stalls in the municipality, but now she is somewhat preoccupied, because 12 of her mid-sized pigs are sick, and she cannot use them. This really has her concerned because if they die, her investment and earnings will be lost.

Ana Maria's dream is to continue conserving her business and continue offering work to other persons. At present, she has three people working for her.

  *The photograph was taken at her house alongside a vending wagon for her tacos.

loans.use: buy a small truck for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Rosa Blanca Group

texts.es:
“Rosa Blanca” está ubicado en una comunidad mazahua muy tranquila, llena de personas muy amables, trabajadoras, es un lugar hermosos en estos momentos todo está verde los campos están llenos de maíz, los habitantes están muy contentos porque en septiembre estarán probando los primeros elotes.
Para llegar al lugar se debe caminar varios Kilómetros porque desafortunadamente no hay trasporte, pero mientras se camina se puede apreciar los cultivos de maíz, se puede encontrar a personas muy amables.
Matilde una mujer trabajadora, dedicada al bienestar de su familia, tiene 46 años de edad está casada desde hace 22 años con el Señor Juventino quien trabaja en el campo, juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando uno universidad y otro en la primaria.
Doña Maty como le dicen de cariño, desde hace 17 años se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de animales como pollos, borregos y pavos, para Doña Maty iniciar esta actividad fue por necesidad “Lo que mi esposo ganaba no alcanza para solventar los gastos de mi hogar así que decidí  probar con este tipo de animalitos así estaba al pendiente del cuidado de mis hijos” comento Doña Maty.
 Recuerda que cuando inicio con la cría de sus animales fue con sus ahorros, después cuando escucho hablar de la institución para ella fue de gran ayuda, porque así pudo comprar mas animales, recuerda que con su primer préstamo solo compro 2 borregos y sus créditos eran muy pequeños pero poco a poco sus ingresos han aumentado y el número de sus borregos ha aumentado ya que ha llegado a tener hasta 15 borregos. El nuevo préstamo lo utilizará para comprar animales y alimento.
Los compra desde pequeños, crece engorda para después venderlos, ahora está solicitando su préstamo para comprar más borregos y alimento para sus pollos y guajolotes, Doña Maty está muy agradecida con el apoyo de sus préstamos porque con sus ganancias ha podido mejorar sus ingresos, darle estudios a sus hijos.
Doña Maty no tiene ninguna dificultad en su negocio solo cuando sus animalitos llegan a enfermarse y mueren para Ella son perdidas de ganancias e inversión pero cuando pasa eso con sus animales de inmediato acude con su veterinario.
La meta de Maty es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera profesional para que puedan mejorar su calidad de vida, La educación de sus hijos es fundamentad para Doña Maty.
Las integrantes del grupo son Teresa y Elidia invertirán en cerdos, Rosa y Elena en becerros, Diana en borregos, José Alberto en accesorios para autos, Itzel en guajolotes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleritas del kiosco del municipio, Doña Maty es quien tiene la chamarra roja*
texts.en:
The "Rosa Blanca" group is located in a very peaceful Mazahua community, which is full of very friendly and hard working people. It is a beautiful place; currently, everything is green and the fields are full of corn. The people are very happy because in September, they will be trying the first of the corn.

To arrive in this place, one must walk many kilometers because, unfortunately, there is no transportation. During the walk, though, it is possible to appreciate the corn crops, and one can find very nice people.

Matilde is a hard working woman, who is dedicated to the well-being of her family. She is 46 yeas old and has been marred for 22 years to Mr. Juventino, who works on the farm. Together, they have formed a family with four children--two of whom are studying, one in university and the other in primary school.

For 17 years, Maty--as Matilde is fondly called--has dedicated herself to raising and fattening animals, such as chickens, sheep, and turkeys. For Maty, starting this work was a necessary. She says that what her husband earned wasn't enough to cover the household expenses; as a result, she decided to try this type of work with animals while she was taking care of her children.

She remembers that when she started raising her animals, it was with her savings. Later, when she heard about this institution, it was a big help for her, because she could then buy more animals. She remembers that with her first loan, she only bought 2 sheep, and her loans were very small. Little by little, though, her income has grown, and the number of her sheep has grown too, so that now she has 15 sheep. The new loan will be used to buy animals and feed.

She buys the animals when they are small; she fattens them and then sells them. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy more sheep and feed for her chickens and turkeys. Maty is very thankful for the support of her loans because with the earnings, she has been able to improve her income and give her children an education.

Maty doesn't have any difficulty in this business. It is only when her animals become sick and die that she has a loss of earnings and investment. But when that happens to her animals, she immediately goes to her veterinarian.

Maty's goal is for her children to finish studying for a professional career, so that they can improve their quality of life. Her children's education is fundamental to Maty.

The members of the group are Teresa and Elidia, who will invest in pigs; Rosa and Elena, who will invest in cows; Diana, who will invest in sheep; Jose Alberto, who will invest in automobile accessories; and Itzel, who will invest in turkeys.

* The photograph was taken on the stairs of the city kiosk. Maty is wearing the red coat.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and food for her chickens and turkeys.

location.town: San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jay Bhadra Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Manisha Sudam, 32, standing on the left, is a dedicated and hardworking micro-entrepreneur from Maharashtra, India. Her area of work is sewing, offering third-party services. She is a divorcee and has a son in her care.

Everything began some months ago when she was working as an operator in a sewing workshop. Now, at the age of 32, she already has her own workshop in which she directly generates two jobs. She works every day. In this way, she generates sufficient resources to help with the economic responsibilities of her house.

Manisha Sudam, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will invest it in the purchase of a double-stitch jeans sewing machine. Thus, she will be able to meet the requirements of her customers and deliver the orders in a timely manner, with the goal of increasing production and acquiring new contracts. This will allow her to give continuity to her micro-enterprise.

Manisha Sudam dreams of continuing to strengthen her workshop and having a greater level of production every day.

loans.use: to purchase a double-stitch jeans sewing machine.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself as honest.

Zakayo operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads.

Zakayo will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, flour, sugar and other items. His business goal is to be the best in the business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soap, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Jay Bhadra Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Vimlabai Punjaram, 47, is the lady standing on the extreme right in the photo. She hails from a small village in Maharashtra, India. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. However, the income of her husband is not sufficient to afford a toilet in his home.

Therefore, Vimlabai Punjaram, along with her group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to build a new and hygienic toilet. Having a toilet will help her reduce unnecessary medical expenditures and provide a healthy life for her family.

Vimlabai Pujaram has a dream of purchasing a truck and starting her own transportation business in order to increase her cash flow.

loans.use: to build a new hygienic toilet

loans.name: Mandira

texts.en:
Mandira is 41 years old and lives in the small village of Khagrabari with her husband and two children (a daughter and a son). Though she has completed her education in grade 12, she is determined to provide a good education to her children. Both of her children are now receiving an education.

Mandira's son, 21-year-old Soham, is an intelligent boy who is pursuing a three-year B.A (Bachelor of Arts) course from Cooch Behar College under North Bengal University. He wants to become a teacher in the future. His mother is engaged in a clothing business and his father works in a spring mill. Through their tireless efforts, they earn a limited amount that hardly covers their family's expenses. To bear Soham’s education expense seems like a burden to them but Mandira is keen to provide her son further education so that he can lead a life far better than theirs. For this, she approached Kiva’s partner BJS to fund her son's further education.

She will purchase her son's necessary study materials and pay course fees for the graduate level education. She also hopes that the loan will enable Soham to continue his education smoothly so that he can establish himself and get a good job in the future.

Mandira and Soham (as in the photo) are thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: to bear the expenses of her son's graduate degree education.

loans.name: Lanleima Group

texts.en:
Memicha, Sumila, Shilla, Puina and Rita are the members of Lanleima Group from Bishenpur District, Manipur, India. They are all engaged in business activities of their own. They have formed this group to take out a loan of 50,000 INR to run their respective businesses.

Memicha is 23 years old and she is the leader of this group. She is the youngest in her group and successfully runs a weaving business in her area. She plans to sell mekhalas, towels, saris, loin wrappers, and bed sheets at her shop. There are seven members in her family and she runs her business to meet their day-to-day needs. With this loan, she will be able to earn up to 6,600 INR that can be utilised for the children’s education, for her business and for health needs.

With the loan, Memicha and Sumila will be able to purchase more raw materials of different varieties of yarn and Shilla, Punia and Rita will be able to add more variety of garments in their clothes shops. With the extra income, they can increase their standard of living and also ensure that their children get a proper education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her weaving business making towels, mekhalas, bed sheets etc

loans.name: N Dorris Group

texts.es:
Los integrates del grupo son Florentino, Carmen y Catalina invierten en borregos, ellos viven en una comunidad muy pequeña tranquila de zona mazahua, donde aun conservan su lengua materna, sus fiestas patronales, son muy alegres duran aproximadamente treo cuatro dias, gran parte de la poblacion se dedica  a la cria y engorda de animales y al cultivo de animales.
El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque Don Florentino participa en un grupo musical y asi se llama el grupo musical realmente es el apodo de uno integrante del grupo.
Doña Alicia una persona muy alegre con un gran espiritu emprendedor, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada desde hace 17 años con el señor Rogelio y juntos han conformado una familia con cinco hijos de los cuales, dos aún estudian su educación primaria. Don Rogelio se dedica a manejar un taxi desde hace cuatro años inició en un automóvil sin permiso para transitar necesitaba arreglar todos sus permisos para poder manejar por todas las comunidades sin mayor detalle. Don Rogelio anhelaba tener un vehículo con placas y autorización para trabajar porque realmente es un buen negocio, así que se acercó al gobierno para solicitar el apoyo y a pesar de que el trámite fue largo, finalmente puede logró lo que quería. Durante los fines de semana, Don Rogelio tiene muy buenas ganancias, aunque se enfrenta al constante aumento de la gasolina. Hay días en los que el ingreso no es el esperado, pero entonces sabe que puede contar con el apoyo de su mujer quien cría pollos, pavos y elabora artesanías bordadas para poner en venta y tener un ingreso extra para solventar los gastos del hogar y educación. Es así que en equipo trabajan para hacer realidad su más grande sueño que es poder ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente. Con el nuevo préstamo que están solicitando Don Don Rogelio dará mantenimiento al taxi y comprará dos llantas mientras que Doña Alicia invertirá en sus animales y artesanías. Doña Alicia se muestra muy agradecida con VFMexico  por la oportunidad de obtener un préstamo porque así podrán invertir en el taxi pero ademas quiere comprar tres borreguitos pequeños porque desde casa tambien quiere apoyar a su esposo "Antes ya habia tenido borreguitos pero no pude hacer crecer mi negocio por falta de dinero pero ahora tengo una oportunidad para hacerlo" comento Doña Alicia.
 *La fotografia fue tomada en
texts.en:
Group members are Florentino, Carmen and Catalina. They invest in lambs. They live in a very small quiet community in Mazahua area, where their native language is still preserved. Their traditional festivals are very upbeat and last about three to four days. Much of the population breeds and raises animals.

The name of the group was chosen because Florentino participates in a band and it is his nickname.

Alicia is a cheerful person with a great entrepreneurial spirit. She is 36 years old and married to Rogelio for 17 years. They have five children and two of them are still in primary school. Rogelio has been a taxi driver for four years. He didn’t have the license initially and needed to arrange all permits to serve the communities. Rogelio wanted a vehicle with plates and authorization to work because it really was a good business. He approached the government to request support. Although the process was long, he finally got what he wanted. During the weekends, Rogelio has very good earnings despite constant increase in gasoline price. There are days when the income is below expectation. But he knows he can count on the support of his wife. She raises chickens, turkeys and sells embroidered crafts to earn extra income to cover the household expenses and education. They work as a team to realize their biggest dream to see their children become professionals.

With the new loan, Rogelio will give maintenance to his taxi and buy two tires. Alicia will invest in her animals and crafts. Alicia is very grateful of VFMexico for the opportunity to get a loan because it allows them to invest in the taxi and to buy three small lambs. She wants to support her husband from home. "I had lambs before but I could not grow my business for lack of money. But now I have an opportunity to do that" commented Alicia.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Aronito

texts.en: Aronito is a 31-year-old father of two. He is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He has been fishing for 13 years now. He works hard for his two children aged two and eleven. He is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and pay for the repair of his house. Aronito hopes to expand his business in the future so he can send his children to higher education and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and pay for the repair of his house.

loans.name: Arika Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising hand in the photo is Joseph, a member of Arika Self help group. He is sixty-five years old, married and a father of four. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

Joseph does vegetables farming in a green house as his main business. He has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled him to manage his business well.

Joseph is borrowing from Kiva to purchase more quality fertilizer, pesticides and seeds which will consequently increase his output and income. This will assist him to cater for his family needs such as food, medicine and in paying school fees for his children. He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Rangpur Group

texts.en:
Minakshi is the group leader of Rangpur Group. She lives with her family of three in Assam, in the northeastern part of India. She runs a beauty parlor shop.

Minakshi realizes the need to increase her savings to secure her children’s future. She feels that their existing income level is not enough to manage the household expenses. Thus, she wants to expand her business and earn a higher income. Minakshi is seeking a loan for purchasing beauty products like facial creams, shampoos, wax, nail polish, etc. for her beauty parlour.

Similarly all the other remaining group members are also engaged in various income generation activities. In order to expand their businesses, they decided to take a loan of Rs 100,000. The income from their businesses will help them boost their income and save more in the long run for their children's education and for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: to expand her beauty parlor

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a salesman. They have seven children. Her eldest is 14 and the youngest is 6. Belinda and her husband work hard to provide for them. She has helped by raising hogs for five years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to increase her profit. Belinda knows how important it is to maximize her business since raising hogs entails a few months before earning her income. Her profit will go towards her children’s education, healthy meals, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 28 years old. She is married with 4 children. She has had a maize farming business for 6 years.

Margaret will be using this loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, and manure. She hopes this will help her pay school fees.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a married man. He has 9 children. He operates a retail business where he sells sheep. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regulars. He will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more sheep. His business goal is to start selling cows and buy a butchery within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more sheep.

loans.name: Pariken

texts.en:
Pariken is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. He has had a motorcycle business for four years.

Pariken will be using this loan to complete the payment for another motorcycle and hopes this will help him pay school fees. His hopes and dreams for the future are have a car for transport and build a big house.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana seedlings

loans.name: Lari Pioneer Vegetable Processors (C.b.o) Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Josephine. She is 61 years old, married, and living with her husband and 6 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development.

Josephine practices vegetable farming and also operates a butcher shop. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy more vegetables and charcoal so as to meet her customer’s demands. She hopes that this loan will enable her earn more income to pay for her family's expenses, e.g. food and clothing. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Kisab Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ruth, a member of Kisab Women Group in Nakuru. She is sixty-seven years old, married, and a mother of six.

Ruth does maize and beans farming. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development and financial management. She has also been able to commercialize her farming and get more profits out of her business.

Ruth is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs, e.g. fertilizers. This will greatly boost her business and the increased income which will enable her to cater for food and other needs for the family. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a humble worker who lives a life full of dreams, hopes and best wishes for his family in the remote village of Naitiri. Life in this village is tough. You must have tough skin to survive but Pius has beaten all the odds. Pius has a lovely family that he really loves and adores and always protects. Pius' upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, he promised himself that he would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why he started farming eight years ago. Through farming, and doing some small personal business (computer business), he has been able to earn a decent income. Pius is the breadwinner of his family, and this really pushes him to work hard so that his family will have a bright future and his parents will have a comfortable life.

Pius is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming so that he can use the excess space on his land. He dreams of buying more land and increasing his horticulture farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for people in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Pius is optimistic that his dream will be realized and his life will completely change.

Through the income from horticulture farming, Pius will assure his children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for his siblings who depend on him. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita es una mujer de 52 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 16 años y su negocio es la artesanía en arcilla.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dinámica, comprometida, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Igachi’ caracterizada por encontrarse a orillas del lago Titicaca, los pobladores del lugar viven de la pesca, agricultura, ganadería y artesanía. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Jovita es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y trabajan la tierra, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe y paja con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no existe el alcantarillado. Su negocio es la artesanía en arcilla, que es uno de los elementos decorativos más usados debido a su escaso costo, sus productos varían, pueden ser tan diversos como platos, vasijas o ladrillos, “aprendí a modelar arcilla desde niña, junto a mi hermano nos ocupábamos de vender piezas para comprar comida…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la artesanía se vende a un precio sin competencia, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una carpa solar para la producción de verduras. Su sueño es contar con una segunda actividad como la venta de verduras de carpa, ella desea realizar la compra de una carpa solar para iniciar su segunda actividad de venta de verduras. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jovita solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de una carpa solar para iniciar su segunda actividad de venta de verduras.
texts.en:
Jovita is a 52-year-old woman, married and has 2 children who are 14 and 16. Her business is clay crafts.

She is a good, enterprising, dynamic, committed, tenacious, responsible and very hard-working mother. She works in the ‘Igachi’ community, characterised by living on the margins of the Titicaca lake. Locals live on fishing, agriculture, farming and crafts. The climate is cold and dry and the temperatures ranges between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Jovita has dark and strong complexion, brown eyes, black hair in a plait and is short. She wears traditional clothes (hat, blanket and pollera, the traditional Andean skirt) and her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish for general knowledge and because of the business she does. She enjoys her life with her husband, who works in agriculture, and her children, who study in school and work the land. They live in a house of their own built with adobe and straw, with a corrugated metal sheet ceiling and brick floor. It has water from a well extracted with a pump,electric power and there is no sewage system. Her business is clay crafts, which is one of the most used decorative elements because of its low price. She has different products which can be very varied, such as plates, pots or bricks. “I learnt to model clay when I was a child. Along with my brother we used to sell pieces to buy food” she says. The advantage of her business is that crafts are sold at an unbeatable price. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a greenhouse to produce vegetables. Her dream is to have a second activity like the sale of greenhouse vegetables. She would like to buy a greenhouse to start her second activity of sale of vegetables. This is the second cycle of loans with the institution in the 10 years she has been in this activity.

For this reason Jovita is requesting a loan to buy a greenhouse to start her second activity of sale of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy a greenhouse to start her second activity of sale of vegetables.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is 47 years old and has six children. Out of those, two are still dependents, ages 14 and 18.

For many years now Arsenia has invested in farming rice and panggal-making. Panggal is a crab trap that is used to catch crabs. This is made of bamboo strips and looks like a basket.

Arsenia would like to expand her business. For this reason, she is asking a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and bamboo. Arsenia hope that in the near future, she will be able to engage in other business opportunities to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and bamboo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy modern banana seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more chickens.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
The lady in the photograph is Sharon. She is twenty five years old, and blessed with two children. Sharon earns a living by farming potatoes and maize. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training she has received, which equipped her with skills to manage her enterprise. The high demand in the market has prompted Sharon to apply for a loan to boost her potato farming, by buying manure and fertilizer. This will increase her supply and boost her business, which will help educate her children.
Sharon is very grateful to kiva and their lenders, and promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariscal Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijas de 9, 19 y 23 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida. 
Ella es buena madre, independiente, paciente, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘panamericana’ área central donde conviven lado a lado empresas públicas y privadas, como; restaurantes, galerías comerciales, cines, heladerías, edificios de departamentos familiares, universidades y todo tipo de comercio, de clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-26 grados centígrados.
Maritza es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto estilo melena, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (se encuentran de pie  ocupando el segundo lugar de la fila iniciando por la  izquierda, viste blusa floreada color plomo, con cabello corto, al lado derecho del señor con polera azul). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijas, la mayor estudia y trabaja y las menores estudian en la escuela y trabajan en el negocio de su madre, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba. Sus sueño de mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de verduras, taller de tornería, venta de comida, artesanía en cuero, venta de carne de pollo, llantería y venta de lácteos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional por días, la tradición lugareña ha destinado un día por semana a diferentes platos típicos, como; LUNES: Escabeche (se sirve frío y consta de cuero de chancho bañados con vinagre, aceite y agua), MARTES: Ranga, (La base de este plato es la panza de res, acompañado de ají amarillo, pimienta, comino y ajo), MIÉRCOLES; Silpancho (significa: carne delgada, aplastada), JUEVES; Tranca Pecho (alimento grueso y basto para peones y albañiles, pero al mismo tiempo antojito de jóvenes y señoritas de todas las clases sociales), VIERNES; Pique Macho (consiste en trozos de carne de res en su jugo y salchicha fritas acompañados de papas fritas), SÁBADO; Lappin (Pecho de vaca asado a la sartén con mote de habas, y papa cocida con cáscara), DOMINGO; Sopa de Maní (sopa a base de maní), “cada día de la semana está dedicado a determinados platos que se pueden encontrar en diferentes restaurantes típicos o puestos de comida al paso en toda la ciudad y sus alrededores…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante grande, ella desea realizar la compra de muebles de comedor para atender a más clientes y mejorar su negocio. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maritza solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles de comedor para vender comida diariamente y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 49-year-old woman, who is married, with 3 daughters, ages 9, 19 and 23. Her business is a food stall.

She is a good mother, independent, patient, generous, friendly, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the Panamericana district of the downtown area shared by public and private sector businesses, such as restaurants, shopping centers, movie theaters, ice cream shops, family-friendly apartment buildings, universities and all types of businesses. The climate is moderate, with daytime temperatures between 18-26 degrees Centigrade.

Maritza is dark-skinned, with light brown eyes and short black hair with bangs. She is short and stocky. Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks here, and she speaks Spanish in mainstream culture and for business transactions. (She is standing, the second from the left, wearing a gray, flowered blouse, with short hair, next to the gentleman in the blue sweater.) She lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and her daughters. The eldest studies and works, and the younger ones are in school and work in their mother's business. They live in their own home, which is made of adobe with a corrugated roof and cement floors. The home has electricity and well water that is drawn with a pump.

Her dream is to improve her business, and this inspired her to form a lending group to apply for a loan to improve their businesses. The members have businesses such as selling second-hand clothing, selling vegetables, a lathe, selling food, leather crafts, a butcher shop specializing in poultry, a tire shop and selling dairy products.

She sells traditional dishes by the day. The custom in that place is to dedicate each day of the week to different traditional dishes; for example, MONDAY, "escabeche" (served cold and made of pig skins bathed in vinegar, oil and salt); TUESDAY, "ranga" (the main ingredient of this dish is beef tripe, served with yellow chili peppers, pepper, cumin and garlic); WEDNESDAY, "silpancho" (which means thin-cut meat, pounded); THURSDAY, "tranca pecho" (a thick, rustic sandwich meant for laborers and construction workers, but also a taste treat for teens and young men and women from all social classes); FRIDAY, "pique macho" (consisting of chunks of beef in their own juice and fried sausage with a side of french fries); SATURDAY, "lappin" (beef brisket cooked in a frying pan with peeled fava beans and potatoes cooked in their skins); SUNDAY, "sopa de maní" (peanut-based soup). "Every day of the week is dedicated to specific dishes that can be found in different traditional restaurants or food stalls all over the city and in the outlying areas," she says.

The advantage for her business is that she sells every day; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy tables and chairs to expand her business. Her dream is to open a big restaurant. She hopes to buy dining room furniture so she can wait on more customers and improve her business. This is her fourth round of loans with the institution since she started her business 10 years ago.

That is why Maritza is requesting a loan to buy dining room furniture to sell food every day and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dining room furniture to sell food every day and improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray his crops for quality production.

loans.name: L'eleveur Group

texts.fr:
Mr BOUKARE est responsable du groupe L’ELEVEUR. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a  05 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 0 enfant va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge. 
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 10 ans, il pratique aussi l’agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 02 moutons, 03 sacs d’engrais et 01 sac de 100kg de graines d’arachide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour payer des bœufs pour l’élevage. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr Boukare is responsible for the l'Eleveur group. He is married and the father of two children. The eldest is five years old and the youngest is under two. None of the children go to school and he has four persons under his care.

He has been a livestock farmer for the past 10 years, and also practices agriculture. He resupplies in surrounding markets. He will use the money granted to buy two sheep, three bags of fertilizer and one 100-kilo bag of groundnut seeds.

He wants to use the profits of the loan to buy oxen for his farm and he also aims to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy two sheep, three bags of fertilizer and one 100-kilo bag of groundnut seeds.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man with six children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a food stall where he cooks food for sale. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of food  ingredients. He will use the Kes 52,000 loan to buy materials to increase the food stall space, to accommodate more customers. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy materials to make the food stall bigger, to accommodate more customers.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children in a very small village in Khagrabari in the Cooch Behar district. She has two daughters who are going to college and a son who reads in grade 8.

Eighteen-year-old Archana is the second daughter of Laxmi and is pursuing her B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) degree from Cooch Behar College. She is a good student and tries her level best to continue her studies with good marks. Now she needs proper guidance for her further education. Her mother Laxmi is working in a local village school and her husband Anil is a small-scale farmer. Both are trying very hard to meet the expenses of their daily needs. As the prices of daily commodities are increasing day by day, providing an education to the children becomes a daydream to them. But they don’t want to compromise anything with their children’s future. Thus, Laxmi seeks economic help from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing Archana’s books and other study materials, paying the exam fees, college fees and enrolling her in good private coaching classes. This help will make Laxmi confident and raise a hope to establish her daughter as a nurse in the future.

Laxmi and Archana express their gratitude towards their generous lenders.

loans.use: To bear the overall education cost of her daughter‘s Bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Joel. He is 35 years old, married and father of 3 children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012.
He sells motor bike spare parts and also does maize farming. He has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, that has helped him with budgeting and record keeping. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy more stock of spare parts . This will assist him to support the family and manage his business well.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy motor bike spare parts.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha wishes to thank Kiva and their lenders for the previous loan which she used to buy quality poultry feed. This increased poultry production and she was able to supply more eggs hence more income. With increased income, she was able to pay for her family's expenses e.g. food and clothing.

She is now borrowing a second Kiva loan to buy poultry feed and vegetable seeds. She hopes that this will increase her income further and enable her to continue providing better food and clothing to her family.

Martha is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued financial support. She promises to continue repaying promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and vegetable seeds and hence increase income levels to provide better food and clothing for her family.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be innovative.

She operates rental houses. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a prime area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to renovate the roofing of her rental houses.

Her business goal is to have more rental houses within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to renovate the roofing of her rental houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his business with soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer de 40 años de edad, separada, tiene un hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por una intensa actividad económica que generó el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Aida es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de chapa y madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, fideo, arroz, refrescos, agua, galletas, productos de limpieza, etc., en su tienda de abarrotes, que por la falta de comercio en el área no cuenta con competencia directa. Actividad que realiza independientemente todos los días de la semana en horas del día, “con mi negocio cubro los gastos de mi hijo y de mi casa sin problemas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que le da tiempo para cuidar a su hijo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la reposición de su inventario. Su sueño es abrir una tienda en el centro de la ciudad, ella desea reponer el inventario de abarrotes de su negocio para satisfacer las demandas diarias de sus clientes y  poder pagar sus gastos familiares. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Aida solicita un préstamo para la reposición de su inventario para surtir su tienda y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Aida is a 40 year old woman, separated, and she has a 4 year old son. Her business is to sell groceries in her neighborhood store.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, patient, responsible and hardworking. Her business is located on the south side of the city, characterized by intense economic activity that gave rise to the development of very large markets with countless galleries and shops. The area has a warm subtropical climate with temperatures during the day that range from 21 to 35 Celsius.

Aida has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair tied back, and a short, robust physique. Her native language is Guarani, which her family speaks, and she speaks Spanish in public and in her business. She shares her life with her son, who is not yet in school. They live in their own home built out of sheet metal and wood, with a tin roof and brick floor; which has potable water, electricity and plumbing to the sewer.

Her business is to sell food and basic necessities, like: bread, sugar, noodles, rice, soft drinks, water, cookies, and cleaning products, etc., in her grocery store; which has no direct competition because there is a lack of this trade in the area. She runs her business by herself every day of the week during daylight hours. She says, “With my business I cover the expenses for my son and my house without a problem.”

The advantage of Aida’s business is that it gives her time to care for her child; the disadvantage is her lack of capital to replenish the inventory. Her dream is to open a shop in the city center. She wants replenish her grocery store’s inventory to satisfy the daily demands of her customers, so she can pay her household expenses. This is her first loan sequence with Emprender in her one year dedicated to this activity.

It is for these reasons that Aida is requesting a loan to replenish her inventory for stocking her store, and with the proceeds, to pay the expenses for raising her son.

loans.use: to replenish her store's inventory, and with the proceeds, to pay the expenses for raising her son.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Ednah is 34 years old and wants to take a big step in her farming business, and she needs your support to do it. She is a mixed farmer who is based in Kuserwo village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She works to improve the conditions of her home. Kapsowar is home to world-famous Kenyan marathon runners. It is also home to many dairy farming and maize farming families.

For the last four years, Ednah has sustained her family through farming. She sells milk and eggs from the dairy cattle and poultry she keeps at her farm. To boost her income, she also does some side hustle business.

Ednah is seeking a loan to expand her poultry farming. She will use the money to acquire more poultry birds. She will go for layers in order to boost egg production. This is suitable for Ednah, since she lives close to the market for eggs. Also, her farm has limited space for free-ranging. Eggs sold from this investment will greatly boost her living conditions.

Ednah stated that her family will enjoy an improvement in financial security with the growth of their asset base after she successfully services the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rayi-Zallem 3 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mme EMILIENNE est responsable du groupe RAYI-ZALLEM 3 SAPONE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Mme fait de la restauration depuis 06 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de haricots.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Emilienne is responsible for the Rayi-Zallem 3 Sapone group. She is the married mother of three children. The eldest is 10 years old and the youngest is under two. Two of the children go to school and she has five persons under her care.

She has been a caterer for the past six years, and gets her supplies from surrounding markets.

With the money granted, she intends to buy two bags of beans. She wants to reinvest the profits from the loan in her business. She aims to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: buy two bags of beans.

loans.name: Junbai 01 Group

texts.en:
Manju, the group leader of Junbai Group - 01 runs a vegetable business. She is the mother of two children and hails from Assam,in the North Eastern part of India. She realized the need to increase her savings, to secure her children’s future. The existing income level is not enough to manage the household expenses. So, she wants to expand her business and earn a higher income.

The other 5 women of the group also want to expand their respective businesses but lack the funds to do so. Together they need a loan of Rs. 138,000. Manju will be using the loan to buy stock like potatoes, onions , tomatoes, etc. Similarly the members of the groups also need working capital to expand their businesses. Your loan will help them contribute more to the household income. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to expand her vegetable business by purchasing potatoes, onion, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Los Pioneros Del Norte Group

texts.es:
Ericka es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, paciente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un área muy demandada por aquellos que quieren tener su tienda o negocio de cualquier tipo y al frente está el Mercado que es muy visitado por compradores de toda la ciudad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Ericka es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la izquierda, viste chompa negra y pantalón celeste). Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan independientemente, viven en una casa propia construida de chapa y madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con actividades como; venta de productos médicos naturales, venta de comida, confección de tejidos, venta de verduras, panadería, librería, venta de refrescos y servicio de construcción, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, shorts, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en horas del día durante toda la semana, visitando diferentes comercios y lugares peatonales, su negocio funciona mediante la venta de ropa de temporada, “ofrezco una amplia selección de ropa, zapatos, bolsos y accesorios de segunda mano, toda la ropa ha sido revisada una a una, verificando su autenticidad y su excelente estado…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y aumentar la oferta. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea aumentar su oferta mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano temporada de invierno por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Ericka solicita un préstamo para aumentar su oferta de ropa de segunda mano de temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Ericka, 26, is a single woman with no children. Her business is second-hand clothing sales. 

She is enterprising, independent, persevering, patient, optimistic, responsible, and a very hard worker. She does business in the Mutualista area, which is in high demand among people wanting to have a store or any kind of business. The adjacent Mutalista Market is heavily visited by shoppers from throughout the city. The city has a warm subtropical climate, with daytime temperatures ranging from 21 to 35 degrees Celsius. 

Ericka has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears pulled back. She is short in stature and has a robust build. Her native language is Guaraní, which is what she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish due to the general culture and her business. In the photo she is the first on the left, wearing a black sweater and light blue pants. She shares her life with her family members, who work independently and live in their own house built of sheet metal and wood with a corrugated iron roof and a brick floor. The house has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.  

Because of her desire to succeed, Ericka joined with a group of people who work together to apply for loans and improve their businesses, which include: natural medicine product sales, food sales, textile making, vegetable sales, bakery, bookstore, drink sales, and construction service. 

Ericka's business is selling second-hand clothing, such as pants, shorts, jerseys, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, sweaters, and jackets. All week during the daytime hours, she works as a street vendor, visiting different business and pedestrian areas. Her business is based on seasonal clothing sales: "I offer a wide variety of second-hand clothing, shoes, bags, and accessories. All the clothing has been checked piece by piece to verify its authenticity and excellent condition," she says. 

The advantage of her business is that she is constantly selling clothing, and the disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to invest and expand her stock. Her dream is to open a permanent stall. She wants to expand her stock by buying second-hand winter clothing in bulk. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in two years that she has been in business. For these reasons, Ericka is requesting a loan to expand her stock of second-hand winter clothing.

loans.use: to increase her stock of second-hand winter clothing.

loans.name: Ima Luxmi Women Group

texts.en:
Premabati, the group leader of Ima Luxmi Women Group, is a weaver by profession. She lives with her family of three in Manipur, in the northeastern part of India.
