By having these agricultural products they can apply them at the right time in order to ensure a good harvest and at the same time the feeding of the family is assured.

She hopes to graduate and work as an English teacher as this has always been her dream. But she also wants to build her own house where she can start her own family and have two children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to apply to her corn and bean crops

loans.name: Amistosas De Rio Seco Group

texts.es:
Yudith es una mujer de 44 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 12 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, amable, generosa, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘El torno’,  ubicado a 32 kilómetros al sudoeste de la ciudad, capital de los cítricos, tiene una producción citrícola de 5 mil hectáreas. De clima de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-24 grados centígrados. 
Yudith es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie, viste de negro, al lado del señor). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de chapa y madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con actividades como; fabricación de velas artesanales, venta de medicina natural, carpintería, venta de queso, confección de sombreros, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cuero, venta de refrescos, venta de huevo y venta de ropa de bebé, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado a la hora del medio día en su puesto de venta fijo al aire libre. La comidas tradicionales más demandadas son; locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso) y ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), “cocinar es un trabajo bastante cansador, toda la preparación demanda tiempo, es por esos que necesito estar abastecida permanentemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su demanda es diaria, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; aceite, arroz, fideo, yuca, carne, etc. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, ella desea abastecer su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina como; aceite, arroz, fideo huevo, carne, papa, chuño, etc., para vender comida continuamente y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 5 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que lleva desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yudith solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para abastecer su puesto de venta de comida y con los beneficios ayudar a sus hijos en la escuela.
texts.en:
Yudith, age 44, is single and has three children; ages 6, 12, and 16. Her business is selling traditional food. She is a good mother. She is kind, generous, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working. She conducts her business in the ‘El Torno’ area, which is 32 kilometers southeast of the city. It is the citrus capital, and it has a production of five thousand hectares. The climate is sub-tropical with a temperature that varies during the day between 18-24 degrees centigrade.

Yudith has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she ties back. She is short and robust. Her native tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish with the general public and for the business that she does. (She is standing next to the man, and she is wearing black.)

She lives with her children, who go to school. They live in their own house, which is made of sheet metal and wood. The roof is corrugated sheet metal, and there is a brick floor. She has running water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

Her desire for self-improvement led her to form a communal bank of people with business activities like making handicrafts, selling natural medicine, carpentry, selling cheese, making hats, selling second-hand clothes, leather handicrafts, selling soft drinks, selling eggs, and selling baby clothes. They formed the communal bank in order to request a loan and improve their business activities.

Her business is selling traditional food, which she does from Mondays through Saturdays. She does this midday at her fixed stand in the open air. The traditional foods that are in the most demand are ‘locotos rellenos’ (peppers, ground meat, onions), rice with cheese (rice, milk, and cheese), and ‘ají de panza’ (tripe, onion, tomatoes on rice). “Cooking is pretty tiring work. All of the preparation demands time. That is why I need to be completely stocked,” she says.

The advantage of her business is her daily demand. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy cooking supplies like cooking oil, rice, noodles, cassava, and meat, etc.

Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

She wishes to stock her business by purchasing supplies like cooking oil, rice, noodles, eggs, meat, potatoes, and freeze-dried potatoes, etc. She will do this in order to sell her food continuously and improve her sales. This is her fifth loan cycle with the institution in the ten years she has been engaged in this business activity.

It is for these reasons that Yudith is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies to stock her food stand. With the profits she will help her children in school.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies in order to stock her food stand and to use the profits to help her children at school.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 61 years old, married with adult-age children and from Pangi, Siquijor. She is a retired master teacher and was supported by her monthly pension and allotment from her children working abroad.

Norma had spent most of her life teaching young minds and also rearing her children to become people. Now that her children had finished college and landed good jobs, she was advised by her children to retire from teaching and take a big break.

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of cement, steel rods, plywood and to pay for labor costs for house repair.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, steel rods, plywood and to pay for the labor costs for house repair.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 40 years old, and married with school-age children. She lives in Pangi, Siquijor. She is engaged in a hog-fattening business that augments her monthly income. She is supported by her husband, who is working abroad as a seaman. She's doing well on her business that is primarily supported by Paglaum MPC.

Currently, she avails a loan to pay for training expenses for her seaman husband.

loans.use: to pay for training expenses of her seaman husband

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities as well as earning for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Juvy wishes to become a supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 65 year old who spends most of her time in the vegetable vending business. She is married with 5 adult age children and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This business venture gives her a monthly income of approximately PHP 5,000 that primarily supports her family's needs. She is financially supported by Paglaum MPC whenever she needs additional capital for her business.

Recently, she took a loan to purchase more stocks of vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 62 years old, a widow with adult-age children who is engaged in a hog-raising business. This type of business has been giving her quarterly income of PHP 20,000 that respond sufficiently to their needs.

Recently, she avails a loan to purchase plywood, sticks, nails, paint, galvanized iron sheets and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to live comfortably on her decent home.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, sticks, nails, paint, galvanized iron sheets and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.en:
Fortunato is 50 years old, a widower with adult-age children from Poblacion, Siquijor, Siquijor. He operates a fishing business that had sent all his children to school until they finished college.

Now that all his children have landed good jobs, he wants to live comfortably in a decent house so he ask for a loan to purchase bags of cements for house completion.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cements for house completion

loans.name: Melicia

texts.en:
Melicia has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years. She and her husband has been tilling their own land for a farming activity that primarily provides for the needs of her family.

Melicia learned about Paglaum MPC and the services it offers, so she signed up for membership. She is grateful for the trust the coop had extended to her, and was able to buy the neighboring parcel of land.

She successfully repaid the loan, and this cropping season, she asks for another loan to augment her production.

The amount of PHP 10,000 is intended to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of insecticides.

Melicia is hopeful that she can have a good harvest this season so that she can repay her loan early with the cooperative.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a farmer and salesperson from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He is married and has two children.

Benard makes a living doing livestock and crop farming on his one-acre farmland. To generate extra income, he also gets his hands on random side-business opportunities that come his way, such as cereal trade.

During harvest season, like now when the circulation of farm produce is high in the market and prices are low, Benard aggregates cereal produce from local farmers. He is seeking a loan to buy as much as he can with the resources available to him. Later, he will sell the same produce but at a higher price because he has a better understanding of the market conditions and prices than a regular farmer.

Income from other sources will be handy in clearing initial loan instalments, but later on, after selling the produce, Benard will recoup his investments. The money that he has been making from this simple trade has been helping him to buy important agricultural inputs and services for his mixed-farm.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
Martha continúa con su negocio de artesanía en cuero. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de cuero por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su mercadería se vendió con éxito (sentada al centro, viste blusa blanca con flores). En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento, los integrantes de la banca tienen negocios como; venta de celulares, taller de costura, venta de vajillas, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té y elaboración de sombreros de sao, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la artesanía en cuero, aprendiendo cada día técnicas nuevas en base a la equivocación y las horas dedicadas, también trabaja el ganchillo y macramé, de manera que si sus clientes quieren un producto que tenga cuero y macramé o cuero y ganchillo sólo se lo piden, “Soy completamente autodidacta, desde que tengo uso de razón me gustó usar mis manos para crear cualquier tipo de objeto, hasta que conocí el cuero…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus artesanías se venden a buen precio, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de trabajo, como; cuero, ganchillo, macramé y otros. Su sueño es abrir una tienda donde vender y exponer sus creaciones. Ella desea realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo para fabricar artículos de cuero y macramé. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de trabajo para fabricar artículos de cuero y macramé.
texts.en:
Martha continues to work in the business of leather crafting. She invested her last loan in the purchase of wholesale leather. She made her payments on time because she successfully sold her merchandise. (She is sitting in the center, wearing a white blouse with flowers.)

Currently she leads the communal bank. The members of the bank have businesses such as cell phone sales, sewing, selling tableware, poultry sales, selling flowers, tea service, and making straw hats. They are applying for credit to improve their businesses.

Her business being leather crafting she is learning new techniques every day based on mistakes and hours spent. She also does crochet and macramé sp that if her customers want a product of leather, crochet, or macramé they only have to ask. “I am completely self-taught. Ever since I can remember I liked to use my hands to create all sorts of things, up until I discovered leather,” she comments.

The advantage of her business is that her crafts are sold at a good price. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy working materials for leatherwork, crochet, macramé and others.

Her dream is to open a store where she can sell and exhibit her creations. She wants to buy working supplies in order to create works of leather and macramé. This is the second loan cycle with the institution in the four years she has been doing this work. It is for these reasons that Martha is asking for a loan to buy work supplies in order to make leather and macramé products.

loans.use: to buy working supplies to make articles of leather and macramé.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a farmer and salesperson from Central Kenya. He practices livestock and crop farming for a living. He is the last born in a family of eight siblings and uses his income to meet his family's basic needs.

To generate extra income, Felix brokers cereal produce. He buys cereal produce when the market price is low and sells it at a higher price whether by looking for better markets or engaging in adding value.

Given that Felix can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, he prefers to stock large volumes of cereal produce. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers, which he will later sell at a higher price using his understanding of the market conditions and prices.

Income from this investment will help Felix generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 53 years old, married with 3 children of adult age and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Brigida is a hardworking farmer and a loving mother to her children. The success of her children as Brigida recalls, has been made possible with the financial support extended by Paglaum MPC to farmers like her.

To gain a head start for the next cropping season, she is taking a loan of PHP 14,900 to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase a good variety of seedlings for more healthier and heavier produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase a good variety of seedlings for more healthier and heavier produce.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 26 years old and is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than three years. Hoa lives in Quang Xuong District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. Her household was recognized by the local government as poor.

A critical difficulty for her family is that they have no latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes this loan will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Chihuahua Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy tranquila se formo un grupo pequeño llamado "Chihuahua" el nombre lo eligió doña Aurelia porque a su esposo le llamaban de esa manera de cariño, Doña Aurelia lo recuerda con mucho aprecio, el grupo lo integran tres mujeres muy amables la comunidad donde habitan es muy tranquila gran parte de la población se dedica  a la elaboración de artesania pero ademas del cultivo de maiz.
 Alejandra una chica muy alegre pero muy inteligente tiene 19 años, está casada y es madre de una niña la cual aun no esta estudiando. Ale como le dicen de cariño en su comunidad platica que desde hace cuatro años se dedica a manejar un taxi.
 “Mi papá era taxista y desde muy pequeña me encantaba salir con él para acompañarlo a trabajar”. Gracias al ejemplo de su papá, ahora ella es una de las mejores taxistas de la región. Aprendió a manejar a los 15 años y poco tiempo después, su papá le regaló su taxi. Alejandra presta su servicio desde muy temprano, trabajando 12 horas diarias, de 8 a 8. “Para nosotros el tiempo es dinero”. Mientras ella trabaja, su suegra le ayuda a cuidar a su niña que aún no asiste a la escuela. 
 Alejandra está muy contenta porque el préstamo le permitirá comprar refacciones para su taxi para ofrecer un mejor servicio, ademas de ser una gran taxista ella se dedica a elaborar artesanía como, calentadores, guantes, bufandas, etc. platica que desde muy pequeña su abuela y mamá le enseñaron a bordar, platica que todos los años en el mes de octubre ella deja el taxi completamente se lo encarga a su papá para que lo maneje mientras ella se prepara para viajar el primero de noviembre a otro Estado de México, ahi se establecen por tres meses y regresa en enero, ahi tienen un puesto fijo, todos los días están bordando y vendiendo al mismo tiempo y cuando requieren de mas mercancía viajan a la comunidad para comprar mas.
 Ella no quiere tener ninguna falta de pago porque pretende que le hagan un nuevo préstamo para invertir en su artesania.
Los integrantes del grupo son  Susana y Aurelia ellas invertirán en bordados.
 *La fotografia fue tomada en las escaleritas del kiosco, Ale es quien tiene en manos unos calentadores"
texts.en:
In a very tranquil community, a small group called "Chihuahua" was formed. Doña Aurelia chose the name because that was what her husband affectionately called her, she remembers fondly. The group comprises three women who are very kind. The community they live in is very tranquil, and a large segment of the population works making artisanal crafts, but they also cultivate corn.

Alejandra is a very cheerful young lady, but she is also very intelligent. She is nineteen years old, and married. She is the mother of a little girl who is not yet in school. "Ale" as she is affectionately called in the community, says that she has been driving a taxi for four years.

"My dad was a taxi driver, and ever since I was very young, I loved going out with him to keep him company while he worked", she says. Thanks to her dad's example, she is now one of the region's best taxi drivers. She learned to drive at the age of fifteen, and shortly afterward, her dad gave her his taxi. Alejandra provides her service very early in the morning, working twelve hours a day, from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. She says, "For us, time is money". While she is working, her mother-in-law takes care of her little girl, who is not yet attending school.

Alejandra is very happy because the loan will allow her to purchase replacement parts for her taxi, so that she can offer better service. In addition to being a great taxi driver, she also makes artisanal crafts such as knitted stockings, gloves, scarves, etc. She says that her grandmother and mother taught her to embroider when she was very young, and she says that every year in October she completely stops driving the taxi, and turns it over to her father, so that he can drive it while she prepares to travel to another state of Mexico on the first of November. She sets herself up there for three months, and returns in January. They have a permanent store there, where every day, they are embroidering and selling at the same time, and when they need more merchandise, they travel to the community to purchase more.

She doesn't want to miss any payments, because she hopes that they will grant her a new loan for investing in her artisanal crafts. The other members of the group are Susana and Aurelia, who will invest in embroidery.

The photograph was taken on the steps of the pavilion. Ale is holding the knitted stockings.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts and tires for her taxi.

location.town: Ejido la Concepcion de los Baños, Ixtlahuaca

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is managing a restaurant business in the Molave Public Market. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers, especially market vendors and farmers coming from nearby towns. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would like to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is a young man of 23 years old, from Kutaisi city in west Georgia. Giorgi earns a living by renting the rooms of his house to the local students, from which he gets 250 GEL monthly. The income is very insignificant for covering even the basic needs of his family and Giorgi requires financial support to create another source of private income. The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1000 USD to purchase all needed tools and equipment to open a traditional Georgian bakery. There Georgian bread will be produced which is very popular among local people.

Giorgi thinks that this business will be profitable for him and he will do his best to deal with any difficulties. He is very motivated and a hard-working person, and he will be very thankful for the help.

loans.use: to open a traditional Georgian bakery

loans.name: Borisi

texts.en:
Borisi, who is a 63-year-old single man, is from a small village named Ghari. He is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person who does his best to make financial stability.

Borisi works as a builder of bridges and also has a small agricultural activity, specifically, he sells nuts and also cultivates a plot of land.

Borisi wants to start a parallel stable activity and build a special fish residence. He will raise trout and will sell at good prices.

Borisi has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will greatly assist Borisi and he will be able to improve his economic situation.

loans.use: to build a special fish residence and start selling trout.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Shennie is 20 years old and is fourth of four children in the family. Her mother Elena is a member of NWTF; she supports the family through her buy-and-sell mango business in the Philippines.

Shennie is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education, and is currently in the third of this four-year course.

Elena is borrowing PHP 10,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Shennie for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Shennie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер 21 летний простой парень из маленького городка Исфара. Он женат и воспитывает маленького сыночка. Алишер с женой занимаются продажей продуктов. Они вместе зарабатывают и обеспечивают свою молодую семью. Алишер учится и работает параллельно. Он учится на 3 курсе экономического факультета в Университете городка Исфара. Алишер хорошо учится, и продолжить учебу. Он учится на платной основе и ему необходимо оплатить этот год обучения. Алишер просит помочь ему оплатить год обучения в Университете, чтобы его не отчислили. Вы можете поддержать Алишера.
texts.en: Alisher is a 21-year-old guy from the small city of Isfara. He is married and has a little son. Alisher and his wife sell grocery products and together they earn a living for their young family. Alisher studies and works at the same time. He is in his third year with the economics department of the city university in Isfara. He is a good student and is continuing his studies. He is a paying student and needs to pay for his tuition for the current year. Alisher asks for help to pay for this year of his studies so he won’t be expelled. You can support Alisher.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for his third year at university

loans.name: Tân

texts.en: Mrs Tân is 34 years old and married. She has had a business sewing clothes for six years. Tân lives in Quang Xuong District, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. This region is often struck by severe storms because it is near the sea. Her family is a low-income household in the village. A critical difficulty for her family is that they have no latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. In 2014, Tân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mrs Ban is 35 years old and she is married.  She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 8 years. Ban lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family has a low-income, and moreover, the income from her business is unstable because the amount of fish her family catches relates to the weather condition.

One of the most critical difficulties she faces is that her family has no latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Ban's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her quality of life.

With her business profit, Ban hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to build a toilet.

loans.name: Shabaan

texts.en:
Shabaan is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has a small cattle fattening business and it is the only source of income for his family. 

He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to make more cheese and butter for sale.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more phonecell credit and electricity credit voucher

loans.name: Hiểu

texts.en:
Mrs Hiểu is 30 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall, selling fish for more than six years.

Hiểu lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by the local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties is that her family has no latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

Although she has many troubles in life, she never gives up. This is Hiểu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.She hopes that this loan could help her improve her life standard.

With her business profit, Hiểu hopes for her business to do well and to maintain a successful business. She also wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer de 52 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos independientes de 25, 27 y 30 años, y su negocio es el comercio de huevos.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, constante, activa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por su intensa actividad económica y el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Aida es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el comercio de huevos, ella compra huevos por mayor directo de la granja para venderlos al menudeo en el mercado, “el comercio de huevos es bastante lucrativo, porque comemos huevos todos los días en el pan, desayuno, almuerzo, etc…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los huevos se venden a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de huevos por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de huevos en su casa, ella desea realizar la compra de huevos por mayor para ofertar mayor cantidad a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Aida solicita un préstamo para la compra de huevos por mayor para ofertar mayor cantidad y abrir un puesto de venta en su casa.
texts.en: Aida is a 52 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has 3 independent children, who are 25, 27 and 30 years old. Her business is selling eggs. She is independent, enterprising, constant, active, patient, responsible and very hardworking. She works in the Southern area of the city, characterized by their intense financial activity and the presence of large markets with many galleries and commercial stores. The area has warm climate, subtropical temperature which varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius. Aida is dark skinned, with brown eyes, short black hair, short, medium built. Her native language is Guarani which she speaks with her family, and Spanish because of general culture and her business. She shares her life with her partner who works in transportation. They live in their own room, made of brick and cement with corrugated iron roof and cement floor. It has running water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is selling eggs. She buys eggs at wholesale prices directly from the farm in order to sell them in smaller quantities at the market. "The egg business is relatively lucrative because we eat eggs every day with bread, at breakfast, lunch, etc...", she comments. The advantage of her business is that eggs are sold daily, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy eggs wholesale. Her dream is to open an egg store in her house. She wants to buy eggs at wholesale prices in order to sell more quantity to her customers. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the three years she has been working in this job. These are the reasons why Aida is requesting a loan to buy eggs at wholesale prices in order to sell more quantity and open a sales stand in her house.

loans.use: to buy eggs at wholesale prices in order to sell more quantity and open a sales stand in her house.

loans.name: Nusratullo

texts.ru: Нусратулло 33 летный мужчина. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Детям 5 и 3 года. Нусратулло вместе семьей живет в красивом городе Турсунзаде. Его жена домохозяйка, она присматривает за детьми. Нусратулло заботливый и честный человек. Он работает в фирме, где производят пластиковых окон и дверей. У него 6 летный опыт и стаж работы. За счет зарплаты он кормить семью. Он хочет отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семьи. Нусратулло просит кредит, по причине, что  с ежемесячной зарплатой не может отремонтировать дом. Он верить в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Nusratullo is 33, married, and a father of two. His children are three and five years old. Nusratello and his family live in the beautiful city of Tursun-zoda. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the children. Nusratello is a caring and honest man. He works at a firm that sells plastic windows and doors. He has worked there for six years and his salary feeds his family. He wants to renovate his house and improve his family’s living conditions. Nusratello asked for a loan because he can’t repair the house on his monthly salary. He trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Mrs Phượng is 24 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall, selling fish, for more than three years.

Phượng lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by the local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral so she can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties is her family has no latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Phượng first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her life standard.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business. She also want her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, who is 33 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Lydia is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps goats and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Lydia makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Lydia can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Lydia’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Lydia a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 29 years old and married with two children. one of whom attends school.He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He desires to complete his permanent house where he will live happily with his family.

Alfred operates a retail shop and does farming as a source of side income. The two businesses have helped in providing for his family and repaying his loan. Alfred intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap among other items to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap among other items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en: Saad, 27, is single and has a walking disability. He had a training course in cell phone maintenance and started a cell phone maintenance business with a 3000 EGP loan from Together Association for Development and Environment, which he successfully repaid. He is requesting a 6000 EGP loan to buy accessories for cell phones such as covers, headsets and chargers to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy items for his cell phone repair business.

loans.name: Patma

texts.en:
Patma is a 42-year-old woman from Marneuli district. She has a pensioner mother, and her son is the only employed person in the family.

Patma has a great desire to make her own source of income and somehow help her son to lead the family more effectively. Having no working experience or higher education, Patma was unable to get a loan or start any stable job. After several unsuccessful attempts, she applied to MFO Credo for credit. Her request was approved within the framework of the Start-Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

Patma plans to open a clothing store at a good location in town, purchase a stock of clothing at wholesale prices, and start selling at increased prices.

With support of the Start-Up program, Patma will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To open a clothing store and generate her own income

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
Juan is a 36 year old man, who is single and has no children. He lives at his parents' house in order to take care of them.

He is a devoted architect and makes a living out of working for an enterprise dedicated to projects consultancy; he prepares budgets for people who want to build their dream.

Juan is asking for a MXN 20,000 loan to repair his van, which he uses every day to go to his work.

loans.use: to fix his van

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr:
Denise est une femme dynamique de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants âgés entre 2 à 17 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dans des écoles privés.
Auparavant, pour gagner leur vie, Denise était lavandière et son mari travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche. Et à cause de la crise politique de 2009 survenu dans le pays, le père de famille était devenu chômeur et pour pouvoir continuer à entretenir sa famille, il vend des engrais et depuis lors, Denise aussi a trouvé l'idée de vendre des  de fleurs et fleurettes et devenir fleuriste.
Actuellement, la famille habite dans une maison en location et c'est la raison qui pousse Denise à effectuer des épargnes afin de pouvoir construire un jour sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Denise is an energetic 36-year-old woman. She is married and has four children between 2 and 17 years old. The oldest are all students in private schools.

To make a living, Denise previously washed clothes and her husband worked in a free zone company. Due to the political crisis the country experienced in 2009, her husband lost his job and in order to be able to continue to support his family, he sells fertilizer. Since then, Denise had the idea to become a florist and sell flowers and florets.

Currently, the family rents a house and this is this reason that motivated Denise to begin saving in order to one day build her own house.

loans.use: to buy flowers and florets

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Hipsy es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 1, 6, 10 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de queques.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dinámica, activa, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ que se encuentra a 20 kilómetros al este de la ciudad, es conocida por la diversidad de comida típica y por su fiesta patronal donde los creyentes van a pie. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Hipsy es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste una básica de color negro y tiene un reloj en la mano izquierda). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación por la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; artesanía en cerámica, elaboración de sombreros de sao, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de helados, servicio de tapicería y pintura de casas, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta ambulante de Queques. El Queque es un bizcocho cocinado al horno a base de harina, huevos, leche y azúcar, que se puede comer a cualquier hora del día, de manera solo o acompañado con té o café. Su negocio lo inicio en su hogar, realizando una mínima inversión con la venta de alfajores, queques de vainilla y de chocolate que llevan insumos fáciles de encontrar en el mercado, a medida que recuperaba su capital, invertía en la oferta de postres para sus clientes, “mi especialidad son los queques de vainilla y chocolate, ambos son muy demandados en especial a meda mañana y media tarde…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus queques son demandados y se pueden comer a cualquier hora, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como; harina, huevos y otros. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de varios tipos de harina, azúcar, huevo e insumos necesarios para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Hipsy solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para hornear variedades de queques y abrir un puesto fijo de venta.
texts.en:
Hipsy is a 35-year-old woman.  She is a good mother and is enterprising, dynamic, active, reliable, responsible, and very hardworking.  She lives with her partner and has four children, ages 1, 6, 10, and 14.  Her business is selling cakes.  She runs her business in the Cotoca area, located about 20 kilometers to the east of the city.  It is known for the diversity of its traditional food and for the patron saint festival where believers go on foot.  It has a subtropical climate with a temperature that falls between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Hipsy is olive-skinned with big, hazel eyes.  She is short in stature with a robust physical complexion.  Her native tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in her home, but she speaks Spanish in the wider culture and in her business.  She shares her life with her partner, who works in the same business.  They live in their own room, built out of bricks and cement with a corrugated roof and a brick floor.  They have electricity, running water, and sewage service.  

Out of a need to help with the school expenses of her children, she has a desire to improve herself.  She created a bank of people to ask for a loan and improve their businesses.  They have businesses such as: ceramic art, making sao hats, food sales, second-hand clothing sales, ice cream sales, upholstery services, and house painting.  

Her own business is making and selling "queques" as a mobile vendor.  A “queque" is a cake made from flour, eggs, milk, and sugar, which can be eaten at any hour of the day, either by itself or with tea or coffee.  She began her business in her home, using a minimal investment to sell “alfajores" [another type of cake] and chocolate and vanilla queques, made with ingredients that are easy to find in the market.  When she had recovered her capital, she invested it in offering desserts to her customers.  “My specialties are chocolate and vanilla queques, which are in high demand mid-morning and mid-afternoon,” she says.  

The advantage of her business is that her queques are in demand and can be eaten at any time of day.  The disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, and others.  Her dream is to open a fixed-location sales space.  She wants to buy in bulk various types of flour, sugar, eggs, and necessary ingredients for her business.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in her year of carrying out this business.  It is because of all this that Hipsy is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for baking a variety of queques and also to open a fixed-location sales space.

She is pictured in the center, wearing a black top with a watch on her left hand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking a variety of cakes, and to open a fixed sales location.

loans.name: Ziyada

texts.ru: Ее зовут Зияда. Ей 60 лет. Она проживает на районе Кубадиён. Она мать двоих детей. Зияда занимается животноводством на протяжении многих лет и этим зарабатывает себе на жизнь. Зияда обратилась за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать дом, дом срочно нуждается в ремонте. Зияда на заемные деньги планирует купить стройматериалы и оплатить услуги рабочих строителей. Зияда готовит дом к зиме, чтобы в холодный период года сохранить тепло и уют в доме.
texts.en: This is Ziyada. She is 60 years old and lives in the Qubadiyon region. She is a mother of two and has been raising livestock for many years to earn a living. Ziyada applied for a loan to renovate her house, which is in dire need of repairs. She plans to use the money to buy building materials and pay a construction crew. Ziyada is preparing her house for winter so she can make her home warm and comfortable during the cold months.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate her house

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona, who is 48 years old, is a married woman and lives in Kutaisi City, West Georgia. She has nine family members but only two of them are employed and earn 400 GEL. However, the family is too big to be financially stable with this income.

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start a clothing and shoes trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Madona's credit requests were rejected several times as she was unable to satisfy their requirements.

Madona received credit within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This startup program gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

With the received credit, Madona will purchase stock of used clothing and shoes and will begin selling at increased prices. She will get her own loyal costumers within her community and neighbourhood and will generate her own income.

Madona and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping her to maintain her trading business.

loans.use: to start trading used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 15 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: San Antonio-73 Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 23 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos; un bebé de 2 meses y 3 hijos de 4, 5 y 7 años, y su negocio es el cibercafé.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dinámica, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por los orígenes de sus pobladores; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del área e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio, de clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie a la izquierda, viste chompa rosa). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y los 2 menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de superación por la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos, la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida tradicional, artesanía en cerámica, elaboración de sombreros de sao, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de frutas, venta de verduras y venta de refrescos, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es el servicio de cibercafé, los servicios que ofrece son; alquiler de internet (maquina incluida) 100 MB, Servicio de impresiones, Servicio de scanner, Mantenimiento de CPU, Cursos de computación, Venta de bebidas, Fotocopias, Venta de accesorios, Venta de computadoras, Etc., “el boom de los negocios de cibercafé ha disminuido un poco, el secreto para mantenerse al frente es aumentando la calidad, tanto en equipos como en servicio…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la actualización del hardware. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio para contar con más clientes, ella desea actualizar los equipos de computación para tener más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para actualizar sus computadoras para tener más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 23 year old woman, she lives with her partner and has 4 children: a two-month-old baby, and three children aged 4, 5 and 7. She runs a cyber cafe. She is a good mother who is resourceful, dynamic, independent, responsible and very hard working.

Her business is situated in the 'Plan 3000' zone, which is known due to the origins of those who
live there: those part of the native Ayorea tribe, and miners originally from the east took over the area and introduced manufacture and commerce.

There is a hot, humid, sub-tropic climate with a daytime temperature ranging from 21 to 35 degrees centigrade. Maria has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long chestnut hair, and is short and strongly built. Her maternal language is Guaraní which is spoken in the area, but she also speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for her work. (she is standing on the left, wearing the pink sweater)

She lives with her partner, who works in commerce, and her children, the two oldest ones study in school, the younger two are not yet of school age. They live in their own home, built from bricks and cement, with a roof of corrugated iron and brick flooring. The house has electricity, running water and a sewage system.

Her desire for self improvement, from a need to help with her childrens' school fees, led her to set up a communal bank, including people with businesses such as: traditional food sales, ceramic handicrafts, sao hat making, second hand clothing sales, sales of fruit, vegetables, and soft drinks, in order to request a loan to improve their respective businesses.

Maria's business is a cyber cafe, she offers services such as: 100mb internet hire (including machine), printing, scanning, CPU maintenance, computing courses, drinks sales, photocopying and sales of computers and accessories. "The boom of cyber cafe businesses has reduced a little, the secret of staying ahead is improving the quality, both of the equipment and the service.." she says. The advantage of this business is that she constantly has customers, but the disadvantage is the lack of funds to update the hardware.

Her dream is to improve her business so that she can continue with more customers. She wishes to update the computer equipment to attract more customers and improve her income. This is the first loan with the institution in the four years that she has been doing this job.

This is why Maria is requesting a loan to update her computers, to have more customer and a higher income.

loans.use: to update her computers, in order to have more customers and increase her income.

loans.name: Asi Es La Vida Group

texts.es:
Carmen es un mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo frito.
Ella es buena madre, amable, paciente, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores, en la mayoría; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, situado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo recogido, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro, lleva una cartera blanca). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos; el mayor inicia la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento, las actividades comerciales de la banca son; confección de tejidos, venta de pescado, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, servicio de construcción y tienda de barrio,  para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de pollo frito, actividad que realiza en un puesto de venta fijo en la calle al aire libre. Su comida se compone de trozos de carne de pollo tierno, a veces enharinados o rebozados, y luego fritos. Lo que distingue a su pollo frito de otras frituras de pollo es que habitualmente las corta por las articulaciones, dejando los huesos y la piel intactos. La piel crujiente bien condimentada, sin exceso de grasa, es el rasgo distintivo de su pollo bien frito; “voy a  construir un techo para cubrir a mis clientes del sol y la lluvia y para ser la elegida del lugar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la construcción de un techo para la comodidad de sus clientes. Su sueño es consolidar su negocio, ella desea realizar la construcción de un techo para cubrir a sus clientes de las inclemencias del tiempo y ser la elegida del lugar. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un techo para cubrir a sus clientes de las inclemencias del tiempo y ser el negocio más popular del lugar.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 28 year old woman. She lives with her partner and have 2 children who are 3 and 5 years old. Her business is the sale of fried chicken.
She is a good mother, patient, generous, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the "plan 3000" zone, an area characterized by its multicultural population, the majority of whom are Aymarás, Quechuas and Guaraníes. The zone is located south of the city where migrants took over and developed a commercial zone that is constantly growing. Its climate is hot and sub tropical with temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade. 
Carmen has a tan complexion, long dark updone hair, she is small of stature and has a robust physical built ([In the photo] she is in the center with a white purse). Her native language is Guaraní which is spoken in this area, and she speaks Spanish in everyday life and in her business. She shares her life with her partner who works in transportation, and with her children; the oldest is starting school and the youngest is not old enough to go to school yet. They live in a rented room built of brick and concrete with a corrugated iron roof, concrete floor and drinkable water, electricity and a septic system. At this time she is leading the entrepreneurial communal bank to take out a loan and achieve their dreams. Their businesses are: sewing, fish sales, empanada sales, cosmetic sales, seasonal clothing sales, construction services and neighborhood store. Carmen is in the business of selling fried chicken, which she sell in a street kiosk. Her food consists in tender pieces of chicken, coated in flour or in batter and then fried. What sets her fried chicken apart from other fried goods is that she usually cuts the pieces at the joints, leaving the bones and the skin intact. The distinctive feature of her fried chicken is the crispy, well seasoned skin that is never greasy. “I will build a roof to protect my clients from the sun and the rain and to be the best in town," she said. The advantage of her business is that her sales are daily; the disadvantage is that she does not have enough money to build a roof to make her clients more comfortable.  Her dream is to consolidate her business. She wants build a roof to protect her clients form inclement weather and become the most popular business in town. This is the second loan with the institution in two years.
For this reasons Carmen is requesting a loan to build a roof to protect her clients form inclement weather and become the most popular business in town.

loans.use: to build a roof to protect their clients from inclement weather and to become the most popular business in town

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cassava flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a small farm in the village of Kiplombe in Rift Valley province of Kenya. This area is a primary milk and maize producing area. Jane is involved in both milk and maize production to provide for her family of 3 children. She has also invested in poultry farming and other side-businesses to earn additional income.

Jane has improved the 2 acre farm tremendously and employs 3 permanent staff to help her run the farm. She has a strategy in place that involves leveraging the business to ensure continuous growth of the farm into the future. She requests a loan to buy seeds and promote crop production. She will be able to secure more land space and farm supplies once the loan request is granted. Come next year when the season is over, she will be able to sell the harvest and make enough money to pay for farm costs for the subsequent seasons. The Eldoret area has a ready market for horticulture farming, hence she will not suffer from losses that occur because of the lack of a market. She will also benefit from the proximity to an airport which will assist her in transporting her products to other markets both internationally and domestically.

This investment will raise her family's living standards. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Twenty-five years ago, Betty started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Betty believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.
Betty waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: 25 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 12 años, y su negocio es la decoración de eventos y cotillón.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, decidida, dinámica, fuerte, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ que se encuentra al este de la ciudad, en este barrio se muestra una cara muy amarga de la realidad, sobre todo porque aquí se dan cita temas tan polémicos como el machismo, trabajo infantil, explotación laboral y otros. De clima cálido subtropical, con una temperatura que ronda entre los 21-35 grados centígrados.
Martha es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro lacio largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste color beige). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocio como; venta de comida tradicional, venta de artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros de sao, confección de tejidos, panadería, carnicería y venta de queso, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la decoración de eventos y cotillón, ella se especializa en la creación de todo tipo de trabajos para fiestas como ser; decoración en globos y telas, cotillón para fiestas infantiles, matrimonios, quince años, cumpleaños, despedidas de soltero, eventos especiales, y todo tipo de acontecimiento, “me dedico a la organización y realización de fiestas y eventos, brindo experiencia, seriedad y profesionalismo para satisfacer las necesidades y exigencias de mis clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con lista de clientes por mes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de artículos y materiales de decoración. Su sueño es contar con más clientela, ella desea realizar la compra de artículos y materiales de decoración para realizar fiestas infantiles. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de artículos y materiales de decoración para realizar fiestas infantiles y hacer felices a muchos niños.
texts.en:
Martha is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has two children, 6 and 12. Her business is providing decorations and party favors for events.

She is a good mother, enterprising, determined, dynamic, strong, reliable, responsible and very hard-working. She operates her business in the "Plan 3000" zone, located in the eastern part of the city. In this neighborhood, reality shows a very bitter face, above all because of problematic issues such as machismo, child labor, the exploitation of workers, and others. The area has a warm subtropical climate, with temperatures varying between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Martha has brown skin, dark eyes and long black hair, which she wears tied behind her. She is short in stature with an average build. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish due to the surrounding culture and the business she carries out. In the photo she is seated at center, dressed in beige. She shares her life with her husband, who works in trade, and with her children, who are in school. They live in a house of their own, built of wood with a metal roof and an earthen floor. The house has drinking water, electricity and sewer connections.

The group's desires to get ahead in life led them to form a communal bank, which includes people with businesses such as selling traditional food, selling leather handicrafts, making hats from sao palm fibers, making woven goods, operating a bakery, operating a butcher shop, and selling cheese. The bank allows them to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Martha's business is decorating and providing party favors for events. She specalizes in creating all kinds of work for parties such as decorations with fabric and balloons, supplies and party favors for children's parties, weddings, 15th birthday parties, other birthday parties, bachelor parties, special occasions, and every type of event. She comments, "I dedicate myself to organizing and carrying out parties and events, and I provide experience, seriousness and professionalism to satisfy my customers' needs and demands."

The advantage of her business is the fact that she has a list of customers for each month. The disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy supplies and materials for decorations. Her dream is to have more customers. She would like to buy decorative items and materials for children's parties. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the three years she has dedicated to this business.

For these reasons, Martha is requesting a loan to buy decorative items and materials for children's parties, which will make many children happy.

loans.use: to buy decorative items and supplies to organize children's parties and make many children happy.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer de 18 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buna madre, dedicada, emprendedora, constante, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por una intensa actividad económica que generó el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Paula es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción, viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a las necesidades de su pequeño hijo, se acercó a las oficinas a solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano; ella se encarga de vender ropa de temporada de segunda mano, en esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de segunda mano temporada de invierno, la razón que tiene es la necesidad de satisfacer la demanda de temporada para generar mejores ingresos y pagar los gastos médicos postnatales de su hijo, “me dedico a la venta de ropa de segunda mano de temporada, la cual rota bastante y constantemente se debe reponer la mercadería…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa de segunda mano rota continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reponer la mercadería vendida. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano de temporada de invierno para reponer el stock vendido y con los beneficios pagar los gastos médicos de su hijo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paula solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano temporada invernal para reponer su mercadería y con los beneficios pagar los gastos posnatales de su hijo.
texts.en:
Paula is an 18 year old woman who lives with her partner and has a one year old son. Her business is selling second-hand clothing.

She is a good mother, dedicated, enterprising, consistent, strong, responsible and very hard-working. Her business takes place in the Southern zone of the city characterized by the intense economic activity that has generated the establishment of large markets with innumerable shops and commercial stands. It has a hot sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Paula is dark-skinned, has brown eyes, long black hair that she ties back, short in stature and thin. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her partner who works in construction. They lives in a rented room made of brick and cement with a metal roof and a cement floor. It has running water, electricity and sewage.

Due to the needs of her young son she has come to the institution to request a loan. Her business is selling second-hand clothing. She handles selling seasonal second-hand clothing. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy used clothing for the winter season. Her reason is that she needs to meet the seasonal demand to generate greater revenues and pay the postnatal medical expenses of her son. "I work selling seasonal second-hand clothing which turns over quite quickly and I constantly have to replenish my merchandise", she comments. The advantage of her business is that second hand clothing sells constantly. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to replace the stock she sold.

Her dream is to open a clothing store.She wants to make the purchase of second hand clothing for the winter season to replenish the stock she sold and with the profits pay for the medical expenses of her son. This is her first loan with the institution in the year she has worked in this business.

For these reasons Paula is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing for the winter season to replenish her merchandise and with the profits pay for the postnatal costs for her child.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for the winter season to replenish her merchandise and pay for the postnatal costs for her child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds to start a horticulture farm.

loans.name: Lilian Coral

texts.es:
Lilian continúa con su actividad de sastrería. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de máquina de coser industrial y cortes de tela para confección. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Su negocio es la sastrería, negocio que se encuentra en plena ampliación y mejoramiento debido a que sus clientes le exigen mayor calidad y rapidez, “estoy terminando de armar mi taller de costura para eso me faltan algunas máquinas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes compran constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina collareta para trabajar con tres o cinco hilos que se cosen en zigzag y recto. Su sueño es abrir una tienda en el centro de la ciudad para vender sus propias confecciones, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina collareta y cortes de tela para continuar con su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lilian solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser collareta y cortes de tela para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lilian is continuing with her tailoring business. She invested the previous loan in buying an industrial sewing machine as well as lengths of fabric to make clothing. She made her payments punctually because she did not have any problems. Her business is tailoring, and it is currently expanding and improving since her customers are calling for better quality and speed. She comments, "I am finishing up the process of equpping my workshop, and for this I am still lacking some machines." 

The advantage of her business is that her customers are always buying from her. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a coverstitch sewing machine, so that she can work with three to five threads which are sewn in zigzag form or straight. Her dream is to open a shop in the city center to sell the clothing she makes. She wants to expand her business by purchasing a coverstitch sewing machine as well as lengths of fabric to continue her business. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the three years she has dedicated to this work. 

For these reasons, Lilian is requesting a loan to buy a coverstitch sewing machine and lengths of fabric to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine and lengths of fabric to continue with her business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre  de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 2 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos médicos naturales.
Él es buen padre, amble, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ dónde hicieron su hogar los damnificados del desborde del río, situado a 12 kilómetros del centro de la ciudad. Los pobladores llegaron de las provincias y el resto del país y se asentaron en esta zona que hoy tiene más del 20% del total de la población, Es el distrito más pobre. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Oscar es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultural general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de comida y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y los menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, Viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento, que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud, como; Calcio Vegetal esencial, suplemento para bajar de peso, Aceite de pescado, hierba conocida como Castaño de Indias, aceite de menta y otros, “Para lucir en todas las épocas del año una piel sana podemos recurrir a los remedios naturales sencillos y rápidos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de productos naturales por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda y una sucursal, él desea realizar la compra de productos naturales para la salud por mayor para que su negocio continué funcionando. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Oscar solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos naturales para la salud por mayor para que su negocio continué funcionando.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 33 year old man. He lives with his partner. He has 3 children who are 1, 2, and 8 years old. His business is the sale of natural health products. He is a good father, friendly, optimistic, patient, responsible and hardworking.

His business is done in the Plan 3000 area where the victims of river flooding made their homes. It is located 12 kilometers from the city center. The inhabitants came from the provinces and the rest of the country and have settled in this area that today has more than 20% of the total population. It is the poorest district. It has a warm subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius.

Oscar has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and short brown hair. He is short and has a robust physique. Mis mother tongue is Guarani that he speaks at home and he speaks Spanish for general cultural purposes and for business purposes.

He shares his live with his partner who sells food and with his children. The oldest attends school and the younger ones are not yet old enough for school. They live in a house owned by the family constructed of brick and cement with a corrugated tin roof and cement floor. They have electricity, drinking water, and sewage system.

His business is selling natural health products, such as calcium supplements, weight loss supplements, fish oil, castano de india [horse chestnut], peppermint oil, and more.
“To have healthy skin all year long we can turn to natural remedies that are simple and fast,” he comments.

The advantage of his business is that sales are continuous. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy the natural products at wholesale. His dream is to open a store and a branch store. He wants to buy the natural health products at wholesale so he can continue in business.

This is the first loan with the institution in the 2 years since he started this work. It is for these reasons that Oscar is asking for a loan to buy natural health products at wholesale so his business can continue operating.

loans.use: to buy natural health products at wholesale so he can stay in business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Janet. She is a 40-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small rural town in the central region of Kenya. Janet and her husband have been blessed with two children.

For ten years, Janet has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening.

In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. Janet, however, is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 47-year-old woman. With her effort and dedication, she has been able to take care of her family. She is based in Bingwa, a remote village in the rich highland areas of Siongiroi in Kenya. This area is known for producing the best milk and their staple food is “mursik,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk.

Juliana has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years and she has made great strides in terms of profit margins. This small scale farmer generates income through selling milk, crops, eggs, and some personal business that she does, or “side hustle” as she likes to call it. Juliana passionately loves poultry farming and the best part is when she wakes up every morning to collect eggs.

The main challenge facing Juliana is the constant perennial shortages of eggs and poultry products in her village and local market. She seeks to change this through a loan to buy more poultry. Juliana is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. With the loan, Juliana will increase her income by selling eggs, poultry meat and also poultry feathers.
