She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors.

Dinah passionately loves poultry farming and as she likes to say “poultry is close to my heart”. Although this humble and ever smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm. She requests a loan to buy more poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Dinah has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity.

She chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. This loan will be a turning point in Dinah’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her products to the market.

loans.name: Ana Rosario

texts.en: Ana Rosario is 45 years old, married and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has been engaged in the rice production business together with her farmer husband since their earlier stage as a married couple. They work hand in hand for the good of their family. Now that Ana Rosario had seen success in farming, she wanted to venture into another business which is palay buying and rice trading. She asked for the needed capital from Paglaum MPC and returned it before the maturity date without default payments. Now that it is another cropping season, she is borrowing an amount to purchase bags of fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a woman with all the spirit for work, who resides in a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. For the past five years, Margaret has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been planting different varieties of crops and some personal business she engages in to earn additional income. She has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Margaret passionately loves dairy farming. Villagers have nicknamed her Mrs. Cow. Margaret sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it is a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This milk production will immediately translate to increased profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan. The extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Margaret is very visionary, and she intends to start adding value to her milk business. All that she patiently waits for is for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Gladys, a young farmer from Nandihills County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Gladys is the proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and some variety of crops she plants. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet.

Gladys passionately loves farming, and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security, which remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nandihills, and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income, and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills, and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and the local market. With your loan, Gladys will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals.

Gladys has been practicing agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo. She believes that her cereal-selling business will increase by leaps and bounds.

There is no doubt that through your loan, Glady's life is permanently going to change, and she will ensure her school-going children have a secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Getrude resides in the Bomet area of Kenya which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family.

Getrude’s primary sources of income are milk, poultry and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Getrude has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Bomet area has conditions that favor dairy farming. Getrude has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow. It’s a breed that produces between 10-15 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Bomet area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Getrude is going to have more milk and comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Getrude to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy.
Loan now and help her out!

loans.use: to buy a quality and superior breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Alba

texts.en: Alba is 49 years old and married with two children of adult age. She is a Microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, where she enjoys the perks of membership. She has availed herself of loan products, insurance and health care services, and various trainings such as Financial Literacy to name one. Alba has been in the retailing business that is financially supported by the cooperative. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase consumable items like canned goods, coffee, noodles and others.

loans.use: to purchase consumable items like canned goods, coffee, noodles, and others

loans.name: Ester

texts.pt:
A senhora Ester de 65 anos de idade é casada, comerciante, mãe de 3 filhos, estes já maiores de idade e independentes, vivem na casa própria.
A cliente dedica-se a venda de roupa diversa e com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar fatos, duvetes, capulanas, mantas, cortinas, feijão e amendoim para reforçar o seu negócio.
Tem como sonho ampliar o seu negócio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Os principais desafios são financeiros e a falta de seriedade por parte de alguns clientes no pagamento mas tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Ester is a 65-year-old merchant. She is married and is the mother of three children who are all adults and independent. They live in their own house.

She makes a living selling a variety of clothing. With the loan she intends to buy niforms, duvets, capulanas [sarongs], shawls, curtains, beans, and peanuts to stock her business. Her dream is to expand her business to meet the needs of her customers.

The main challenges are financial and a lack of responsibility on the part of her customers when it comes to payment. However she has been working and hopes to take more loans to overcome her difficulties and acheive her dreams.

loans.use: to buy uniforms, duvets, capulanas [sarongs], shawls, curtains, beans, and peanuts to stock her business.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is blessed with two children who are her greatest motivation in life. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Ann was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past ten years.

Ann has always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in her blood. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day; this helps her support her family. Ann also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Ann is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Ann believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Ann's way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a lively and resilient woman. She is from the Siongiroi area, an area that is very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict. With work and effort and without complaint, she wants to bring her family ahead. Christina has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Christina is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life.

Of all the activities she is involved in, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows, she has named them, which makes Christina very proud, and she feels fulfilled. Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Christina wants to take full advantage. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to grow with.

She is requesting a loan which she will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. Christina has grass, so feeding the cows will never be a challenge. She also owns an expansive piece of land, and the excess space will be productively used once she acquires the additional dairy cow. The "exotic" cow she will buy will produce between 8 and 10 liters of milk per day, and this will translate to more income and profits. The profits from selling milk will allow Christina to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. She projects that she will be able to start a biogas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs. With your loan, all that Christina dreams of is a secure future for her family. Christina awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Venessa Katherine

texts.en: Vanessa is a young lady, 27 years old. She has two children, a 7 year old that is at school and a 2 years old, attending by special programs for childcare. She owns her store, where she sells everyday products, candy and soda. The store is located in a place where the buses go on the road to the Ecuadorian coast. The credit is to expand her business by buying more products and also buy underwear because it is a demand in this place. Vanessa wants to get ahead for the welfare of her family, and does not want to be financially dependent on her husband. She says that there are times she feels down. She is optimistic, enthusiastic and determined.

loans.use: to buy more products and also buy underwear because it is a demand at her store

loans.name: Kübra

texts.en:
Kübra is a young entrepreneur of age 25. She is earning her own money for school by making and selling her own jewelries. She sells her jewels to her friends. She also makes personal designs upon request. With the help of the loan from Maya, she bought bulks of materials for her jewels.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Kübra Hanım 25 yaşında genç bir girişimci.  Takı yaparak ve bunların satışını yaparak kendisinin okul harçlığını çıkarıyor.  Yaptığı takıları kendi arkadaş çevresine satıyor.  Müşterilerinin istediği şekilde tasarımlar yaparak kişiye özel takılar da yapıyor.  Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan takı malzemesi aldı.

loans.use: to buy jewelry materials

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.en: María is 46 years old. She has been married to her husband, Segundo (pictured), for 25 years. She has 6 children, 2 of them attend university and 2 basic education. They have dedicated their lives to agriculture. They grow cucumber, tomato, beans and “morocho”. This is an opportunity for Maria and her family to move forward with the improvement of their crop, which will allow them to improve their living conditions. They need this credit to buy fertilizer, and pay for oxen to plow the land. She has the dream of seeing her children become professionals, especially his little girl of 5-years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and to pay for oxen to plow the land

loans.name: Abrahan Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir is a young man of 26 years. He has a 1 and a half year old child. His hopes are to be able to achieve a the change of his life, to give his child a better future. He wants to marry the mother of his child, build his home, and provide for his family through the fruitful work of his agriculture, which he has learned throughout his life. Today he is required to lease his land and wants his credit to plant cucumbers. His dream is to have his own land and his own house.

loans.use: to plant cucumbers and one day own his land his house

loans.name: Javier Homero

texts.en: Don Javier, has been s a farmer all his life. Since childhood he has been dedicated to agriculture. He has 3 children. His life has been very hard; and he's concerned about not being able to improve his economic conditions in order to provide his children professional studies for them to succeed. He is a good, quiet, hardworking man and enjoys participating in community activities. He grows beans, peppers, tomatoes, but he is worried of market prices which are permanently changing. Today he wants his credit to buy seeds of beans. He considers himself a happy person and always wanting to excel. This will be the opportunity to provide the opportunity to his family for growth and progress.

loans.use: to buy seeds of beans in order to provide for his family

loans.name: Nelda Ines

texts.en: Ines is 52 years old. She is divorced and manages her business alone. She owns a traditional restaurant located in Lita rural parish, which is considered one of most impoverished sectors of Ecuador. She always keeps her restaurant very clean, and the place is well known for the special seasoning that she uses in the food. She wants her credit to improve the presentation and cleanliness of her business and therefore increase traffic. She will buy ceramic tiles for the kitchen floor, and try to have better amenities so more people want to come.

loans.use: to improve the presentation and cleanliness of her business so more costumers will come to eat

loans.name: Cecilly

texts.en:
Cecilly is a 50-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kerugoya, which is a small rural town in central Kenya. Cecilly and her husband have a lovely family.

Cecilly has been a mixed-farmer for more than 10 years and raises poultry and grows maize and vegetables. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path.

Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Cecilly is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya. Cecilly is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. Cecilly seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kerugoya and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she deals with currently. She will use the increased income to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also comfortably educate my children.”. Go for it and give Cecilly a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (M.F.I.'s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Beatrice, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 27 years of age. She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She loves and treasures her family and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Beatrice's primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 5 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Kapsowar area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income. Beatrice upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Beatrice has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Beatrice is quite visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
While many young people in Kerugoya area of Kenya dream of getting well-paying jobs, Mary, from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, has never secured one and she opted to become a full-time smallholder farmer. She decided that she would be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. Mary is married and blessed with lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat.”

Her primary sources of income are selling milk, pig farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice pig farming was not a difficult decision for Mary. Mary has earned a decent income from pig farming for six years. The demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase the number of pigs, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds, so she seeks a loan to purchase additional pigs.

Pig farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya, because it creates business opportunities for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that will always be needed. Pig farming is a less strenuous activity and it is profitable. Many pig farmers find a sense of fulfillment having pigs all over their homestead. If taken seriously, pig farming has the potential of being a big business, because the demand for pork products is always high. With your loan, Mary is going to earn more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. Mary is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs.
